excerpts: I ordered for my husband's fortieth a banana cake with vanilla frosting and filling.
Their pastries and sliced cakes are out of this world.
Thank you for the memories.
banana.author: Petite M.
banana.review: Scrumptious. Mouth-watering. Perfect. My husband ordered for me a freshly made dulce de leche cake. I ordered for my husband's fortieth a banana cake with vanilla frosting and filling. Their pastries and sliced cakes are out of this world.  Thank you for the memories.

excerpts: The Banana Tres Leches cake.
banana.author: Jennifer C P.
banana.review:
If there's one thing I know it's cake. 

I mean I know a lot about a lot of things but the one thing in this entire universe I am so super confident about in my real world experience of eating, making, baking, gifting and being gifted ...cakes would be it. 

I love cake. I love cake more than wine, whiskey, cheese, books, breakfast, a parking spot in SF, and the color pink. 

That is a LOT of love! 

The St Honore cake everyone raves about is good. The Italian cherries are lovely, the depth of chocolate is really nice, the boozy levels are too high for me. This is a difficult cake to make for the home baker when you take apart the individual technical merits/skill level you need coupled with the price of the quality ingredients this cake demands. Reminds me of making an Opera cake. Same demands on ones skill, time, and cost per slice. 

SOLUTION: BUY IT HERE!! My personal taste in no way reflects badly on the quality. It's definitely there. This is a stunner and others who like punchy obvious flavors in their mouth will love, no, worship this cake! 

But for those of us with refined, discerning taste. Let me steer you to what is easily the most elegant non-European cake I have had the pleasure of eating more than one slice in a sitting.

The Banana Tres Leches cake. 

Fresh bananas, wonderfully fluffy whipped cream, cake with a firm but tender crumb (to stand up to the soaking), and a base layer soaked in cream that isn't flimsy/doesn't fall apart. This cake is a visual and gastronomical delight!

The perfume of fresh bananas, the fatty cream and whipped cream, coupled with the texture of the cake make this the perfect choice for a special event (or if you are like me, a weekday) This doesn't keep so order a size that you will completely finish in a day.

If all that cake-loving talk wasn't enough praise, the cookies! I love Stella D'oro cookies from the market. I like the circles with pink or white frosting. Cheesy? Yes. Throwback to my childhood? You bet!

The same flavor can be found in the cookies here. Better quality cookie, more tender crumb, lovely Italian cherries, chocolate, and or nuts grace the individual varietals. Get a pound of cookies, brew some coffee, and take some time out of life to savor your alone time. 

I still grab a bag of Stella D'oro's when I see them but let's not tell lies here. That slide out box of store bought cookies pales in comparison to the freshly baked deliciousness the cookie case here boasts. 

I just love sweets. My gosh. 

I love this bakery. They completely justify my love for cake and everything that requires butter, flour sugar, eggs, leavening, and an oven. 

Five stars - well done!

PS: You can phone same day to order a cake for pick-up. My family did. It was easy peasy perfect!

excerpts: We normally order the famous Dianda cake with cream puffs but this time we ordered chocolate cake with banana filling and OMG was it the best!!!
Perfect sweetness, not too sweet and fluffy moist cake with a light whip filling  perfection
banana.author: Lea G.
banana.review: We normally order the famous Dianda cake with cream puffs but this time we ordered chocolate cake with banana filling and OMG was it the best!!! Perfect sweetness, not too sweet and fluffy moist cake with a light whip filling  perfection

excerpts: Banana.
banana.author: Angela B.
banana.review:
Best Italian cake in California!

You have to taste it to understand why this bakery is so good​ and expensive.

Cakes can range from $40-100+.

A slice of cake is now $4.25 which is probably not expensive to the influx of techies who moved into the Mission, but it hits the pockets of the loyal natives who have been there since day 1. 

Small families can't afford expensive cakes. It's also the size. Basically your average cake for 15 people is around $25, but Dianda's could set you back $45-$70 depending on what cake you get. They go from a 12 inch round to massive cakes.

Best cakes.
Strawberry. However, the last time I got a slice, the strawberries seemed hard . There was something different. It wasn't the same cake I'm used to.

Banana.
Lemon
Pineapple.
Chocolate.

They have a new flavor: tres leches and pineapple. Hmmmmmm. Not sure. Will have to try that another time.

I think it's the whipped cream, too. It's soft, moist and tasty.

Dianda's get 5 stars for taste, but 3 for pricing.

excerpts: So we went ahead a tried a new flavor a banana cream.
Omg... it was delicious!
Seem like you can't go wrong with any flavor.
And did I mention the price for a slice?
Only $4.50 you can not beat it!
banana.author: Jeannette C.
banana.review: I have tried the tres leches cake from here and it is my absolute favorite! Today we were hoping to buy a piece but they were already sold out. So we went ahead a tried a new flavor a banana cream. Omg... it was delicious! Seem like you can't go wrong with any flavor. And did I mention the price for a slice? Only $4.50 you can not beat it!

excerpts: The rum cake is my favorite, but the banana and chocolate is also so good.
Cookies and canolis are amazing.
banana.author: Marlene M.
banana.review: Best Italian bakery in Northern CA. I've been coming here for over 20 years. The rum cake is my favorite, but the banana and chocolate is also so good. Cookies and canolis are amazing.

excerpts: Strawberries, Pineapple, Banana, and even Mango!
banana.author: Judith G.
banana.review:
My first time at Dianda's was yesterday. I went in to pick up a cake for my coworker's birthday. I specifically wanted tres Leches. They had a variety of choices! Strawberries, Pineapple, Banana, and even Mango! 

The cake was nice and moist. Their custard was light and palpable. I'm usually not a fan of custard so this is a high compliment. 

The decoration on the cake is old fashioned but tasteful. Over all I'd say I had a pleasant experience. I think I'm lacking the nostalgia that others have for this place. After all I'm an L.A. raised gal, but all in all 4 stars!

excerpts: traditional pumpkin strawberries banana you name it
they have it through seasons
the ladies who work there are very nice answer questions.
Hall fresh-baked danishes every morning pies and artisan bread.
this place I recommend
I know the prices are  fare because you're paying for quality if you want to spend less money for poor quality then go to Safeway or Albertsons
you won't get to the freshness there.
All items are brought daily from their San Francisco sister properties store in the city!
banana.author: Thebay A.
banana.review:
This Bakery is an authentic Italian-American pastry shop from fresh Danish pies to Classic desserts on to full-on cakes and Artisan breads you can sit and have coffee or you can pick up and take to go during the whole year they have different seasonal items traditional pumpkin strawberries banana you name it they have it through seasons the ladies who work there are very nice answer questions.
Hall fresh-baked danishes every morning pies and artisan bread.
 this place I recommend I know the prices are  fare because you're paying for quality if you want to spend less money for poor quality then go to Safeway or Albertsons you won't get to the freshness there. 
All items are brought daily from their San Francisco sister properties store in the city!

excerpts: Their banana cake?
Not bad, if you're into bananas, but I certainly prefer mine in pie form.
banana.author: Johnny W.
banana.review:
My first experience (there have been several more since) with Dianda's was somewhat mixed. A coworker had brought in two large boxes with a selection of most of their cakes, and I, in my greed, decided it was wise to attempt to try every single one of them. Sugar, cream, and carb overload ensued twenty minutes later for this clever lactose-intolerant Asian.

Highlights? Definitely their chocolate strawberry cake and their tiramisu, both of which were pretty fantastic. Their banana cake? Not bad, if you're into bananas, but I certainly prefer mine in pie form. Their rum puff cake, alas, was a little disappointing.

Texture wise, their cakes are all of the sponge variety: so, nice and fluffy. Prices are also quite reasonable, given the portion sizes! A solid 3.5 stars.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Your typical bakery with display cases all around. Theirs are of the shorter variety, so one can easily see the top shelf, as they're roughly eye level, even while sitting. When they're busy, it does get a little cramped, but for the most part, maneuverability isn't an issue.

Bathroom - Pretty sure I didn't see any open to the public.

excerpts: I ordered the tres leches with banana, it was delicious!!
A little pricey but good
banana.author: Rosa R.
banana.review: Cakes are really good!! I ordered the tres leches with banana, it was delicious!! A little pricey but good

excerpts: Which is why I was surprised that we got a sub-par birthday cake with banana filling for my mom's birthday (filling, topping ok, and the actual cake was dry beyond anyone's comprehension).
We order another cake for our twins B-day (raspberry filling with light frosting to balance the sweetness of it).
Everything was great until we had a piece of the cake, same as in June the damn bread (cake) was dry.
The cake was $60.00, I was expecting the bread to be moist, not drier than the Sahara desert (it had that sandy feeling since it was dry).
Because when it comes to the cake bread it is a huge disappointment.
I cannot believe that I would rather have a Safeway generic piece of crap B-day cake over the ones they make in Dianda's
The three stars are for service counter people, who will do their best to meet your expectations, and the filling/frosting of the cake.
They have lost my business for sure, as a long time customer I am extremely saddened that the quality of the cakes have fallen, not to mention the price they charge because it was amateur at best.
banana.author: Daniel A.
banana.review:
For years Dianda's has produced excellent to order pastries and birth cakes. Which is why I was surprised that we got a sub-par birthday cake with banana filling for my mom's birthday (filling, topping ok, and the actual cake was dry beyond anyone's comprehension). Since this was the first time we though it was a fluke, we probably  got the baker in a bad mood and did not put the same level of attention when he was making it (this was back in June).

We order another cake for our twins B-day (raspberry filling with light frosting to balance the sweetness of it). Everything was great until we had a piece of the cake, same as in June the damn bread (cake) was dry. The cake was $60.00, I was expecting the bread to be moist, not drier than the Sahara desert (it had that sandy feeling since it was dry).

It makes me wonder if they still have the same people from 5 years ago baking the pastries and cakes. Because when it comes to the cake bread it is a huge disappointment. I cannot believe that I would rather have a Safeway generic piece of crap B-day cake over the ones they make in Dianda's (yes it was that bad except from the frosting and filling).

The three stars are for service counter people, who will do their best to meet your expectations, and the filling/frosting of the cake. They have lost my business for sure, as a long time customer I am extremely saddened that the quality of the cakes have fallen, not to mention the price they charge because it was amateur at best.

excerpts: I really like there tres leche banana cake and there rum cakes too.
All the pastries I have tried from there have always been so delicious!!
Two thumps up for this place!!
banana.author: Silvia R.
banana.review: I have been coming to this bakery since I was little with my family. Diandas has never done us wrong. Yes a bit pricey but def. Worth it! I really like there tres leche banana cake and there rum cakes too. All the pastries I have tried from there have always been so delicious!! Two thumps up for this place!!

excerpts: The banana cake, the napoleon, and the chocoalte eclair is delicious!!!
banana.author: Allie B.
banana.review: This place is by far one of the best bakeries when looking for italian desserts.  My family has been ordering cakes from this place since I was young. The cake that we order most is the St. Honore cake; the cake consists of a rum filling and cream puffs surrounding the cake with a hard caramal sugar bottom. It is delicious, the bakery is definitely on the pricey side but totally worth it. The other pastries are really good as well. I've tried there cake slices and they are bomb. The banana cake, the napoleon, and the chocoalte eclair is delicious!!!

excerpts: I got the banana cream cake.
The cream and banana were delicious, but the cake itself was really dry.
banana.author: Jen H.
banana.review:
I hate to rain on everyone's parade, but I might have ordered the wrong item. It seems like most ppl on Yelp are raving about their Rum Cake.

I unexpected drop by this place after having lunch at La Taqueria. Should've yelped first before ordering. I got the banana cream cake. The cream and banana were delicious, but the cake itself was really dry. 

Price is not bad: $3.50/piece. I wouldn't mind trying this place again next time when I am in the area, and TRY soemthing else.

excerpts: The banana tres leches cake is amazing!
Moist and rich, yet light.
Simply divine.
All of their cakes/pastries are scrumptious!
I love family run businesses like this...old school goodness at its best.
banana.author: Kim W.
banana.review: Dianda's is an institution on Mission St.  The banana tres leches cake is amazing! Moist and rich, yet light.  Simply divine.  All of their cakes/pastries are scrumptious! I love family run businesses like this...old school goodness at its best.

excerpts: Best Strawberry Banana Cake, Rum Cake,
Banana mini things....
banana.author: Julio P.
banana.review:
I Been Eating Pastries from here since I was 5! Love this Place. Best Strawberry Banana Cake, Rum Cake, Banana mini things.... 

One of the Best Pastry Shops in the city.

excerpts: So I got a chocolate moose cake, a couple cannolis, and banana cream thing.
I gave the banana cream thing to my nephews to share since I didn't want to be a total glut.
They said, "It's good, Uncle Dan."
Then they made me pick them up and spin them until they almost yaked it.
They're only 4 and 2, respectively.
I think I'm the one who almost ended up yaking.
banana.author: Dan B.
banana.review:
Once in a blue moon someone brings in Dianda's almond tort thing.  I think it's a great way to start the morning.  My favorite thing about is that it also temporarily leaves red stains on your teeth.  I just  can't help but flash my red teeth after someone has shown me theirs.  It looks pretty psychotic to see a group of people smiling and pointing to each other's teeth.  Maybe not psychotic, but definitely a scene from animal kingdom.

Anyways . . . 

I had no desire to visit until LiL y.'s review mentioned tres leche.  I like a good tres leche.  But when I went, they didn't have any.  I figured that since I was here, I'd better try something.  So I got a chocolate moose cake, a couple cannolis, and banana cream thing.

Chocolate moose is good once warmed to room temperature.
Cannoli had a light cream filling that wasn't overly sweet and a pastry shell that NYC folks would appreciate.
I gave the banana cream thing to my nephews to share since I didn't want to be a total glut.  They said, "It's good, Uncle Dan."  Then they made me pick them up and spin them until they almost yaked it.  They're only 4 and 2, respectively.  I think I'm the one who almost ended up yaking.

excerpts: The banana cake with whipped cream was wonderful, as was all the goodies in the box.
I guess I'll have to go there more often!
banana.author: Jacquelyn P.
banana.review: I hadn't been here for years, but for my 70th birthday I decided I wanted a St. Honore cake. I found out I could take BART and just walk a block so I did. Overwhelming variety of luscious pastries. She asked me if I wanted small or large. Well the small one was huge. They encouraged me to let them put "Happy Birthday" on it. It was wrapped up in a nice box and tied with string and I got home on BART fine. We had it that day (and the next and the next) and it was SO GOOD! I shared with the neighbors and they, in turn, sent me a box of pastries from Dianda's a couple of days later. The banana cake with whipped cream was wonderful, as was all the goodies in the box. I guess I'll have to go there more often!

excerpts: I was picking up a pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving and couldn't resist one of their chocolate banana pastries for myself, it was unbelievably good.
banana.author: Manny F.
banana.review:
I try to avoid Dianda's. If I came here regularly it would kill me so I only come here for special occasions. 

I was picking up a pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving and couldn't resist one of their chocolate banana pastries for myself, it was unbelievably good.

excerpts:
Sweet Hunt, item #4:
"one slice of Chocolate & Banana cake, please".
But I have to admit.. this cake was pretty good.
Moist and airy that you can easily eat more than 1 slice.
Need to come back to grab one for my banana-loving man.
He will probably give it 5 stars.
And I will come back to get something NOT banana.
banana.author: Sue Y.
banana.review:
Sweet Hunt, item #4:
"one slice of Chocolate & Banana cake, please".

I like bananas (fruit on the peel itself), but never really in my desserts. But I have to admit.. this cake was pretty good. Moist and airy that you can easily eat more than 1 slice. Need to come back to grab one for my banana-loving man. He will probably give it 5 stars. And I will come back to get something NOT banana.

excerpts: We special ordered a Tres leches cake with banana for a birthday party last week.
The cake portion tasted so dry and stale that we didn't even want to eat it.
The icing and middle were fine but definitely not worth the $32 price.
Disappointing after having read all of the positive reviews.
banana.author: Robert R.
banana.review: We special ordered a Tres leches cake with banana for a birthday party last week.  The cake portion tasted so dry and stale that we didn't even want to eat it.  The icing and middle were fine but definitely not worth the $32 price.  Disappointing after having read all of the positive reviews.

excerpts: Well, I guess it was worth the $$$, we tried the banana cake and another circular like sponge cake.
Our fav was the banana cake, so light and fluffy and delightful!
We'll go back to try the other cakes!
Woohoo....
banana.author: Yan M.
banana.review:
When wandering after brunch, we stumbled upon this bakery. There was a line on a Sunday afternoon, one customer was busy tasting several pieces of cakes to order for her next event, another were picking up various slices so we browsed around and decided on what we wanted. 
We saw someone picked out a huge cake and we thought this was Mission area and you'll get a cake for less $$$ but were we wrong, the cake was $100!! 

Well, I guess it was worth the $$$, we tried the banana cake and another circular like sponge cake. Our fav was the banana cake, so light and fluffy and delightful! We'll go back to try the other cakes! Woohoo....

excerpts: When i was little, my parents would always buy our birthday cakes here, but i just went there last Nov 05' to order their wonderful banana cake...
I was sooo disappointed, it was not moist
, it tasted old like they made it 2 weeks ago, and very dry.. the flavor of the banana cream was lingering somewhere, but couldn't taste it too much...
Great in the past, but not no more!!!
banana.author: Karen F.
banana.review:
When i was little, my parents would always buy our birthday cakes here, but i just went there last Nov 05' to order their wonderful banana cake...I was sooo disappointed, it was not moist, it tasted old like they made it 2 weeks ago, and very dry.. the flavor of the banana cream was lingering somewhere, but couldn't taste it too much... 

Great in the past, but not no more!!!

excerpts: Banana lovers WILL love banana chocolate cake!
Light, airy, and not overwhelmingly sweet or banana-ie.
banana.author: Lynn T.
banana.review:
Banana lovers WILL love banana chocolate cake!

Light, airy, and not overwhelmingly sweet or banana-ie.

excerpts: OK I had the banana cake and the red velvet cake and they were delicious!
I had the cookies and they were ok
but I am not much of an almond base cookie person.
But the cake was amazing!
banana.author: John K.
banana.review: OK I had the banana cake and the red velvet cake and they were delicious!  I had the cookies and they were ok but I am not much of an almond base cookie person.  But the cake was amazing!

excerpts: phooey to the one star banana cake experience go back and try something different.
As far as I can remember, I have always gotten a birthday cake from Dianda's.
I've tried every kind of pastry ever sold here
and I love them all even the sugar free cookies
My favs though are the chocolate rum cake and the cream puff cake which I call bolitas cake

(small balls cake)

mmmm
banana.author: Yessenia M.
banana.review:
this place should get 10 stars! phooey to the one star banana cake experience go back and try something different.

I love pastries and Dianda's is the reason for this. As far as I can remember, I have always gotten a birthday cake from Dianda's. I've tried every kind of pastry ever sold here and I love them all even the sugar free cookies :) My favs though are the chocolate rum cake and the cream puff cake which I call bolitas cake :) (small balls cake)

mmmm can i also recommend the candies they sell here, just yum yum. If the store were edible I'd eat it too :)

excerpts: banana cake is also good.
trust me you will find something you like in  dianda's
banana.author: Christian P.
banana.review: the napoleon is freaking good, i always get it when i go to dianda's. banana cake is also good. trust me you will find something you like in  dianda's

excerpts: I ordered a Mango Tres Leches Cake which was $37.75 and feeds 8-10 people: http://bit.ly/2mRQRLj.
mango.author: Cherylynn N.
mango.review:
3.5 STARS 

As I was waiting to pay for a cake:

Guy: "I think we should get married."

*Points at wedding cake topper*

Woman: "Awww, really?!"

Me *thinking*: "GUUUURRRLLLL, LOCK IT DOWN! LOCK. IT. DOWN!!!!!"

Ok, I know what some of you are thinking: Who proposes in a bakery...without a ring?!

For those who have dated commitment phobic men, you know what's up.

Forget the 2 carat minimum, I'll gladly take the ring from the gum ball machine! 

I don't know if he was being serious, but if he was...good to luck to the happy couple. 

Our intern was leaving and our secretary found out her fav cake was Tres Leches Cake. After a quick search on Yelp, I found that Dianda's was highly praised for their Tres Leches Cake. The cakes aren't fancy, they're old school, Aqua Net style but seem to be a crowd pleaser. 

Cakes orders require a 3 days' notice but I called in 2 days prior and they accepted my order. So, if the cake order is simple, you may not have to call in 3 days in advance. A deposit is required for all orders.  

I ordered a Mango Tres Leches Cake which was $37.75 and feeds 8-10 people: http://bit.ly/2mRQRLj. The 3 layers of leche: milk soaked sponge cake, custard, and whipped cream was rich and sweet but the mangos were slightly tart so everything kind of balanced out: http://bit.ly/2FUo5m3. 

Not really my style as the soaked sponge cake tastes just like it sounds, like a wet sponge but for those who like tres leches, I'm sure they'll feel differently. My co-workers said, they liked it (or maybe they didn't want to hurt my feelings).   

For cakes, my preferences are Fancy Wheat Field Bakery (San Bruno Avenue), Schubert's (Clement Street), Ambrosia Bakery (Ocean Avenue), and Tartine (Guerrero Street).

They spelled our intern's name wrong so I suggest asking them to repeat the spelling twice just to make extra sure. 

If anyone has another recs from Dianda's, kindly send them along. Maybe, I'll even see another "proposal"!

excerpts: It was whip cream with Mango.
mango.author: Chris C.
mango.review: My boss is Italian so I decided to surprise him with a birthday cake from Dianda's. They were so helpful over the phone, picking the most incredible cake. It was whip cream with Mango. It was ready right on time and while I was there I even got myself a little personal size cake for later.  The whole office was raving about this cake it was a huge hit!

excerpts: I have been ordering strawberry whip cream and mango wip cream cake for over 15 years my family has been customers of your establishment for 20+ years .
I picked up my cake order with the wrong colors printed on my cake I specified for no dark icing.
My order was mango  cake with whip cream
I order this several times.
My order was mango  cake with whip cream
I order this several times.
My son has a severe nut allergy we opened the cake to sing happy birthday n the cake has nut shavings on the bottom of the cake.
So now my son has no cake on his birthday.
Sent from my iPhone
mango.author: Lolo L.
mango.review:
Today is my sons birthday. I have been ordering strawberry whip cream and mango wip cream cake for over 15 years my family has been customers of your establishment for 20+ years . I picked up my cake order with the wrong colors printed on my cake I specified for no dark icing. My order was mango  cake with whip cream I order this several times. My son has a severe nut allergy we opened the cake to sing happy birthday n the cake has nut shavings on the bottom of the cake. So now my son has no cake on his birthday. 
Sent from my iPhone

excerpts: Strawberries, Pineapple, Banana, and even Mango!
mango.author: Judith G.
mango.review:
My first time at Dianda's was yesterday. I went in to pick up a cake for my coworker's birthday. I specifically wanted tres Leches. They had a variety of choices! Strawberries, Pineapple, Banana, and even Mango! 

The cake was nice and moist. Their custard was light and palpable. I'm usually not a fan of custard so this is a high compliment. 

The decoration on the cake is old fashioned but tasteful. Over all I'd say I had a pleasant experience. I think I'm lacking the nostalgia that others have for this place. After all I'm an L.A. raised gal, but all in all 4 stars!

excerpts: I ordered a mango tres leche cake on Sunday.
It looked amazing but sadly it was not moist.
It was flavorful but lacked that authentic tres leche moistness and flavor.
mango.author: Robert O.
mango.review: I've been here many times for their cookies, pastry and cakes. I ordered a mango tres leche cake on Sunday. It looked amazing but sadly it was not moist. It was flavorful but lacked that authentic tres leche moistness and flavor.

excerpts: I've had the eggnog, rum and mango cakes.
I've had an assortment of their cookies too.
Everything is sooo good!
Whenever I'm in SF this is one of those places I make sure to hit.
mango.author: Esther F.
mango.review: It took me a while to try a cake at Dianda's since I'm normally not a cake buyer... but this place changed everything for me. This could easily be the best bakery in town. The cakes here are delicious and authentic Italian inspired. They have a variety of flavors that you can't get anywhere else like rums, and fruity cocktail flavors. I've had the eggnog, rum and mango cakes. I've had an assortment of their cookies too. Everything is sooo good! Whenever I'm in SF this is one of those places I make sure to hit.

excerpts: Instead of the usual cake my parents get from the Chinese bakery, my mom went for a mango tres leches cake from Dianda's.
One of the most delicious cakes I've ever have had the pleasure to devour!
Which was also a mango flavor, and that was pretty good as well.
mango.author: Marissa J.
mango.review: I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER BIRTHDAY CAKE FROM ANYWHERE ELSE EXCEPT HERE EVER AGAIN! : ) Although I didn't go and pick this place for my b-day cake. Instead of the usual cake my parents get from the Chinese bakery, my mom went for a mango tres leches cake from Dianda's.  One of the most delicious cakes I've ever have had the pleasure to devour!  It was perfection, and that's what a Birthday cake should taste like. Even better then my wedding cake! Which was also a mango flavor, and that was pretty good as well. If you're thinking of somewhere to get a cake for that special someone... THIS IS YOUR PLACE!

excerpts: I love their Mango leches and cookies.
I always try to go there when I am in the Mission.
mango.author: Axa M.
mango.review: Guilty pleasure bakery.  I love their Mango leches and cookies.   I always try to go there when I am in the Mission.

lemon.author: Rod M.
lemon.review:
Never had heard of this place and I didn't have it bookmarked either but I saw a bunch of people inside so I decided to hop in....

Three popular items are: 

Napoleon -made by sandwiching crispy layers of puff pastry with a rich custard pastry cream filling. This dish was amazing !! I liked this considerably more than the almond tort. First time trying it. 
Almond tort- was not my thing. Def liked Napoleon more and I'm sure I'm sure I would have liked the cannoli more.
Canolli looked good but didn't try it

excerpts:
Lemon
Pineapple.
lemon.author: Angela B.
lemon.review:
Best Italian cake in California!

You have to taste it to understand why this bakery is so good​ and expensive.

Cakes can range from $40-100+.

A slice of cake is now $4.25 which is probably not expensive to the influx of techies who moved into the Mission, but it hits the pockets of the loyal natives who have been there since day 1. 

Small families can't afford expensive cakes. It's also the size. Basically your average cake for 15 people is around $25, but Dianda's could set you back $45-$70 depending on what cake you get. They go from a 12 inch round to massive cakes.

Best cakes.
Strawberry. However, the last time I got a slice, the strawberries seemed hard . There was something different. It wasn't the same cake I'm used to.

Banana.
Lemon
Pineapple.
Chocolate.

They have a new flavor: tres leches and pineapple. Hmmmmmm. Not sure. Will have to try that another time.

I think it's the whipped cream, too. It's soft, moist and tasty.

Dianda's get 5 stars for taste, but 3 for pricing.

excerpts: No candied orange or lemon peel on top, but the more common cherry kind with the classic dusting of confectioners sugar.
lemon.author: Lew A.
lemon.review:
Ok, I love the Cannolis di Ricotta here, always buying at least two when visiting. Even if the shell & filling aren't separated before ordering (tsk tsk), they have the right size, toothsome texture for the shell (a soft crunch) while the filling offers the miniature chocolate chips in a sweetly firm ricotta with traces of vanilla & citrus. No candied orange or lemon peel on top, but the more common cherry kind with the classic dusting of confectioners sugar. Each one about $3.95. 

However, the service here is dreadful, while a wait occurs even if there's no one else in the bakery. Some serious 'tude is common with the servers.  

On a side note, I took these cannolis to Philz down the street & had them with my coffee. I sat outside with my java, and a young homeless man approached me. Seeing what I was eating and inquiring, he offered to trade his bottle of vodka for my cannoli. I turned him down, but for him to wanna give up his alcohol for my cannoli.............

excerpts: Last week we ordered a small lemon cake for my daughter-in-law's birthday; it was also great!
lemon.author: Melissa B.
lemon.review:
One of these days I'll find a bakery here in the East Bay that understands that Crisco isn't an essential ingredient in cakes, but until that day I'll be going to Dianda's, even if it's a hike and a grubby BART ride to get some of the most delicious, fresh, well-made cakes and treats on the planet.

Recently called early one morning to ask for their largest round cake for a guy in the office (a sheet cake would have been tough to schlep on BART), and was delighted when the woman who answered the phone said they could make it right then and I could pick it up at lunch!  I chose Chocolate Strawberry -- in short, it was outstanding and was gobbled up faster than any cake we've ever had at work.  I ended up having to send an "everybody" email because so many people asked me where the cake came from.

Last week we ordered a small lemon cake for my daughter-in-law's birthday; it was also great!  There is nothing better than a cake that seems light and fluffy but which is full of flavor and taste!

Oh, and if you like meringues -- Dianda's has them (in miniature) in the showcase and they are like a little bite of heaven in your mouth -- they melt like butter and all I can say is be careful -- it's easy to eat a dozen and not even feel it!

Cannot say enough about Dianda's -- delicious, reasonably priced, ultra fresh, and yet a bit old school, all at once.  Great place!

excerpts: The little lemon pies are heavenly, too.
Be sure to get a number!
lemon.author: Bryan M.
lemon.review:
Pastries, cakes, and cookies .....OLD SCHOOL!
When running errands in the Mission....I always have
to make a swing through Dianda's.  The brownies are fab! Dense fudgey brownie with nuts, and a little frosting.  The Red Velvet is not the Southern version I love....but.....their recipe has grown on me.  The little lemon pies are heavenly, too.  Be sure to get a number!

excerpts: This place also makes some of the best lemon tarts I've had in San Francisco, and I've had a lot of great lemon tarts here.
lemon.author: Lauren S.
lemon.review:
This place is off the hook. Everything is fresh. It's not faux bakery crap. And I can appreciate that. This place also makes some of the best lemon tarts I've had in San Francisco, and I've had a lot of great lemon tarts here. Real talk.

They take credit cards and that's always nice cause when I'm craving a sweet- can't go to Mission Pie..but can go here!

excerpts: And sometimes they make rum and lemon cake or rum and strawberry.
What gets better than that?!
lemon.author: Milz T.
lemon.review:
Mmmmmm Yummy cakes!!!

This is by far the best bakery in the city. They have a variety of different kinds of pastries and different flavors. You won't be disappointed. Although it's a little expensive, their cakes are worth every penny.

Plus, they have RUM cake!! And sometimes they make rum and lemon cake or rum and strawberry. What gets better than that?!

excerpts: If you go also check out the italian hard candies-anise, lemon, orange.
Give Dianda's a try, you won't be sorry.
lemon.author: Eric W.
lemon.review: Mmm!  Unfortunately I needed a cake for a company party for a company going out of business... Fortunately the tiramisu cake ordered from Dianda's was a huge hit!  My boss (formerly in the restaurant biz) raved about the cake, the next day another employee called me to say he too loved it... he asked if I made it (I wanted to say yes-but answered honestly).  I have ordered about 6 cakes in all from Dianda's over the years, and everytime each was made just as ordered and delicious each time.  I've also gotten danish, cookies (all sorts), petit fours, cake by the slice.... oh... my mother-in-law (Italian decent) loves the cannoli... says best had in her 87 years.  If you go also check out the italian hard candies-anise, lemon, orange.  Give Dianda's a try, you won't be sorry.

excerpts: I ordered the cherry and raspberry cookies, which were a bit dry, but hey, I expected cookies to be dry anyways
cherry.author: Henry L.
cherry.review:
Popular pastry shop right next to the Bart Mission-24 stop

This quaint little pastry store always seem to have more customers than there is space. The chocolate, cookies, and cakes all looked fresh and colorful, and the staff who work there all seem to be pretty nice. The price is ok--reasonable given the quality. I ordered the cherry and raspberry cookies, which were a bit dry, but hey, I expected cookies to be dry anyways :)

If I needed to get a cake for a special occasion (e.g. birthdays etc), I would definitely go grab a cake from this place.

excerpts: No candied orange or lemon peel on top, but the more common cherry kind with the classic dusting of confectioners sugar.
cherry.author: Lew A.
cherry.review:
Ok, I love the Cannolis di Ricotta here, always buying at least two when visiting. Even if the shell & filling aren't separated before ordering (tsk tsk), they have the right size, toothsome texture for the shell (a soft crunch) while the filling offers the miniature chocolate chips in a sweetly firm ricotta with traces of vanilla & citrus. No candied orange or lemon peel on top, but the more common cherry kind with the classic dusting of confectioners sugar. Each one about $3.95. 

However, the service here is dreadful, while a wait occurs even if there's no one else in the bakery. Some serious 'tude is common with the servers.  

On a side note, I took these cannolis to Philz down the street & had them with my coffee. I sat outside with my java, and a young homeless man approached me. Seeing what I was eating and inquiring, he offered to trade his bottle of vodka for my cannoli. I turned him down, but for him to wanna give up his alcohol for my cannoli.............

excerpts: I haven't been there to often in the last year or so, but this weekend my loving Husband stopped in and bought one of those almond cakes and my favorite, a Chocolate Cherry cake.
But that Chocolate Cherry cake?
That was just beyond bad.
But that Chocolate Cherry cake?
That was just beyond bad.
The cherries, which were previously tart sweet and tasted of cherry, have been replaced with an artificial tasting cherry filling.
The thick whipped cream based filling and frosting is now a gross greasy frosting/buttercream with a shortening base.
Yuck.
cherry.author: Sara D.
cherry.review:
Talk about Hero to Zero...

I first remember entering Dianda's in the 70's. The signature Almond Torte was so good. Over the years I have had pretty much everything they make. Once upon a time I was there often enough to be a regular, even rated a smile from the counter ladies. I stayed a customer when the original owners sold to the current owners and while there were a few rough patches to get through they managed.

I haven't been there to often in the last year or so, but this weekend my loving Husband stopped in and bought one of those almond cakes and my favorite, a Chocolate Cherry cake.

WHAT a disappointment.

The Almond Torte wasn't bad. But it was a bit dry, and seemed to have less almond paste than previously.

But that Chocolate Cherry cake? That was just beyond bad. The cherries, which were previously tart sweet and tasted of cherry, have been replaced with an artificial tasting cherry filling. The thick whipped cream based filling and frosting is now a gross greasy frosting/buttercream with a shortening base. Yuck. The chocolate ganache has been replaced with an overly sweet chocolate coloured icing.

The quality of ingredients has taken a HUGE hit recently. And the taste has too.

Just bad news all around. Man am I sad : -(

excerpts: From what i know, the macaroon, the vanilla cookie, the one with the cherry on it, the halloween decorated ones, the flaky almond one.. those were my favs!
Oh yeah
they had a hazlenut honey cookie or something
cherry.author: Shelley N.
cherry.review:
After pointing to all the cookies and asking what is that and what is in there.. would be really nice to have little signs giving the name and a short description of what is in them... but anyways... i bought 1/2 pound which was about 15 cookies or so for $7.50. Not bad... 

I wanted to try them all, so after opening my box. I took all my cookies out and took a bite out of each and every one of them. Since there was no way possible i could eat all 15 in one sitting and i really wanted to know how they tasted. And since there are no names... i really wouldnt know which ones to tell you are the ones i liked the best. 

From what i know, the macaroon, the vanilla cookie, the one with the cherry on it, the halloween decorated ones, the flaky almond one.. those were my favs! Oh yeah they had a hazlenut honey cookie or something.. that was pretty good too. 

Bottom line.. i liked them all and will definitely go back for more!

There cakes looked really good. Next time i might have to try those!

excerpts: Cherry filling in between soft chocolate cake with a cherry on top of delectable frosting...
cherry.author: Anthony L.
cherry.review:
I can't write one for the old location on Green and Columbus so I guess writing one for this one would be just the same. But be warned, I have never been to this one and only speak for myself when I say what I am about to say. And please remember that the Dianda's I am talking about is from North Beach and is now some sort of a coffee shop slash notary or something of another...

My first taste of a chocolate mousse was at Dianda's. My first Napolean, also from Dianda's. Come to think of it, every single piece of Italian pastry I have ever had for the first time, 85% of them came from here. And how can you not like what they made? The chocolate mousse was always rich and creamy with a deep chocolaty taste that makes you shiver with goodness. And the Napoleans were to die for! I have yet to find another Napolean that is like theirs. And the Black Forest cakes...This is the reason why I love cherries! Cherry filling in between soft chocolate cake with a cherry on top of delectable frosting...Man, I need some right now...

I might make it a point to try the Dianda's in the Mission. Hell, I knew they had one in the Mission for a while now. Just never would think about buying Italian pastries in the middle of the Mission. I'm thinking more along the lines of burritos and cow brain tacos and horchata when I am out here...

excerpts: UPDATE:  Went there again this morning and forgot all about the cherry and apple turnovers!
I'm upping my grade to 5 stars now.
cherry.author: Big Toe ..
cherry.review:
True, old school, Italian pastries.  Really, probably the only place you can get true Italian pastries in SF, and they have the most kick ass cream horns and clairs anywhere.  Personally, the almond torte is out of this world.  Nice selection of cookies and other delectables too.  Absolutely worth a trip to this place.  
UPDATE:  Went there again this morning and forgot all about the cherry and apple turnovers!  I'm upping my grade to 5 stars now.

excerpts: The peach cake is my favorite
peach.author: Linda J.
peach.review: Best in town. Love the flavor not too sweet just perfect! Must order in advance always! The peach cake is my favorite

excerpts: and I was going to ask for the peach  one but the sales lady said we have pineapple too and have this square cake ,
I ask which one is most  delicious she recommended.
peach.author: Emilia E.
peach.review:
Well today I bough my daughters birthday cake 
We use to buy at this place all my family cakes birthdays 
But the past tree cakes tres leches are not that good as they use to be 
Today I was trying to get chocolate one but was sold out and I was going to ask for the peach  one but the sales lady said we have pineapple too and have this square cake , I ask which one is most  delicious she recommended. Pineapple well I believe but this is the worst cake I had from diandas  last one  was ok but today nobody of my family liked the cake  I paid $70 dollars for it 75% cake went to trash  I'm very disappointed. 
The cake had way too much pineapple syrup fill way too much almost all inside was the pineapple thing too sweet  the bread stuff  was like 1 centimeter on tap and bottom !

excerpts: It looks like a massive pile of fruits; strawberries, blueberries, pineapple, peach, and kiwi with a nice surprise inside.
It is delicious.
If you're up for it, you can eat the entire tart ;)
peach.author: Glu C.
peach.review:
The St. Honore cake is one of my favorite cakes here, it's so goooood, I love the custard. It's one of the best pastries they have. Make sure to order your cakes ahead of time cus there's lines during the holidays. Their panettone is dry, Lucca Ravioli and Chico's have better pantonnes. There's also a bunch of cookies and candies to chose from, including sugarfree cookies which are ok.

Update: They have bigger fruit tarts filled with custard. It looks like a massive pile of fruits; strawberries, blueberries, pineapple, peach, and kiwi with a nice surprise inside.  It is delicious. If you're up for it, you can eat the entire tart ;)

excerpts: New favorites to add to the list the custard filled horn and the peach filled fruit cake.
Wowza...
I have yet to try something here that I don't like.
peach.author: La C.
peach.review: OMG!  New favorites to add to the list the custard filled horn and the peach filled fruit cake.  Wowza...  I have yet to try something here that I don't like.

excerpts: We've ordered the Chocolate Strawberry Cake, Tres Leches Cake, Red Velvet Cupcake and White Chocolate Strawberry Cake.
In the morning I would sometimes get a bear claw or almond croissant.
Their cannoili are famous but I haven't had the urge to try them since I'm usually only there for breakfast or to pick up a cake.
I highly suggest calling ahead to reserve a cake since they run out quickly.
red velvet.author: Kitty K.
red velvet.review:
Having used to work across the street from here, it really doesn't help if you're trying to diet. Many times we have ordered from here for special occasions at work. We've ordered the Chocolate Strawberry Cake, Tres Leches Cake, Red Velvet Cupcake and White Chocolate Strawberry Cake. In the morning I would sometimes get a bear claw or almond croissant. Their cannoili are famous but I haven't had the urge to try them since I'm usually only there for breakfast or to pick up a cake.

All great pastries. Around lunch time, they often have a line out the door. I highly suggest calling ahead to reserve a cake since they run out quickly.

excerpts: I haven't tried many items, but I did get a slice of red velvet cake.
I believe the price was under $4, which isn't too bad.
It was neatly decorated with a rose.
It had a lot of frosting, too sweet and artificial...
but still okay
red velvet.author: Connie M.
red velvet.review: I haven't tried many items, but I did get a slice of red velvet cake. I believe the price was under $4, which isn't too bad. It was neatly decorated with a rose. It had a lot of frosting, too sweet and artificial... but still okay

excerpts: I've loved just about everything I've had from this bakery (except the red velvet and tres leches.
Those are okay).
red velvet.author: Kristina E.
red velvet.review: This is my favorite bakery. Every year like clockwork, the birthday cake for myself and my brother comes from here (at least 20 years of birthday cakes) so my mom stopped asking us for cake preference years ago. I've loved just about everything I've had from this bakery (except the red velvet and tres leches. Those are okay). Any of their signature rum cakes are my favorite. The individual pastries are a little pricey, but worth it in my opinion.

excerpts: Great pastries, great cookies, great cream horns, great red velvet cake, and their cakes topped with colorful flowers are the way old-fashioned cakes SHOULD taste like:  yummy, moist, well-balanced, and not overly sweet!
red velvet.author: Ted K.
red velvet.review:
Great pastries, great cookies, great cream horns, great red velvet cake, and their cakes topped with colorful flowers are the way old-fashioned cakes SHOULD taste like:  yummy, moist, well-balanced, and not overly sweet!

A San Francisco institution, still going strong...for good reason!

Oh, and the gals who work the counter are always nice, helpful, and patient! A rarity with today's youth

excerpts: I didn't realize it was an Italian bakery until I walked inside its heavenly premise full of sweet thangs, cakes, red velvet and more!
red velvet.author: Megha S.
red velvet.review:
A friend of a friend told me to hit up this bakery for their tres leches cake - supposedly one of the best in the city! I called them up a day before I needed the tres leches, and a lady took the order for about 30+ peeps and patiently transcribed all of the details I requested.  I didn't realize it was an Italian bakery until I walked inside its heavenly premise full of sweet thangs, cakes, red velvet and more!

I was a lil confused because I heard the owner speaking in Italian and then the workers in Spanish (the same thing actually happened 3 days ago when I started sprinkling random Italian words in a conversation with a Costa Rican waiter (we were at a pizzeria in Manuel Antonio) who replied in Spanish and then went off in Italian hah) but it didn't really matter!  I didn't want a repeat of that funny yet embarrassing situation so I stuck with using the universal English in picking up the lovely cake.  Appearance wise, the tres leches with fresas looked aite, but when we all took a taste, it was really yummy.  

Dianda's got the tres leches goin on!  Check it.

excerpts: The Red Velvet is not the Southern version I love....but
.....their recipe has grown on me.
red velvet.author: Bryan M.
red velvet.review:
Pastries, cakes, and cookies .....OLD SCHOOL!
When running errands in the Mission....I always have
to make a swing through Dianda's.  The brownies are fab! Dense fudgey brownie with nuts, and a little frosting.  The Red Velvet is not the Southern version I love....but.....their recipe has grown on me.  The little lemon pies are heavenly, too.  Be sure to get a number!

excerpts: OK I had the banana cake and the red velvet cake and they were delicious!
I had the cookies and they were ok
but I am not much of an almond base cookie person.
But the cake was amazing!
red velvet.author: John K.
red velvet.review: OK I had the banana cake and the red velvet cake and they were delicious!  I had the cookies and they were ok but I am not much of an almond base cookie person.  But the cake was amazing!

excerpts: I had the red velvet piece of cake and it was delicious but too much sugar
so I could only eat half.
The lady took my card and it didn't go through for some reason
and she was grumbling something at me
lol
But other than that, the service was pretty good.
red velvet.author: Lucky N.
red velvet.review: I don't normally go to bakeries, but my friend took me here cause he needed to get a cake. Right when I walked in, the smell was so inviting! It's big and bright with lots of dessert! I really don't have a big sweet tooth at all, but it looked great. I think It would have looked more attractive if some of the shelves weren't completely empty. That kind of didn't make it look so great, but what was there did look good! I had the red velvet piece of cake and it was delicious but too much sugar so I could only eat half. The lady took my card and it didn't go through for some reason and she was grumbling something at me lol But other than that, the service was pretty good. My friend got something written on his cake, which is cool that they do that, but when I saw it, it looked like the lady was in a complete rush and did it all messed up and looked like she wrote in half printing and half cursive. That's jacked up cause he paid $30+ for a cake and that was pretty and then she jacked it up with her hand writing. If you don't have good hand writing, you should be writing on someone's cake. I wouldn't have been too happy if that was my cake I was getting for someone... But otherwise, it's pretty cool for one of my first times in a bakery.

excerpts: I got a slice of black forest cake, and it was pretty good!
A little sweet for my taste but no complaints!
black forest.author: Carmen C.
black forest.review: I love their great selection of desserts. Theres so many cakes as well as cookies to choose from. It's hard deciding on what to get! I got a slice of black forest cake, and it was pretty good!  A little sweet for my taste but no complaints!

excerpts: The black forest cake is also terrific ... and for Easter, you can't beat the St. Honore cake.
The cookies are so yum and sold by the pound.
black forest.author: Allen E.
black forest.review: we've been coming to Dianda's for decades!  My favorite cake is the white cake with strawberries and whipped cream frosting.  The black forest cake is also terrific ... and for Easter, you can't beat the St. Honore cake.  The cookies are so yum and sold by the pound.  We took a Dianda's cake to a restaurant once and a nun sitting at the table next to us pointed to her friend that it was a Dianda's cake ... I overheard them, so I made sure they got a couple of pieces.  At another restaurant, the bartender noticed the box in the kitchen and one of the servers meekly asked if their bartender could have a small piece.  LOL!  Everyone loves Dianda's!  :-D

excerpts: And the Black Forest cakes...
This is the reason why I love cherries!
black forest.author: Anthony L.
black forest.review:
I can't write one for the old location on Green and Columbus so I guess writing one for this one would be just the same. But be warned, I have never been to this one and only speak for myself when I say what I am about to say. And please remember that the Dianda's I am talking about is from North Beach and is now some sort of a coffee shop slash notary or something of another...

My first taste of a chocolate mousse was at Dianda's. My first Napolean, also from Dianda's. Come to think of it, every single piece of Italian pastry I have ever had for the first time, 85% of them came from here. And how can you not like what they made? The chocolate mousse was always rich and creamy with a deep chocolaty taste that makes you shiver with goodness. And the Napoleans were to die for! I have yet to find another Napolean that is like theirs. And the Black Forest cakes...This is the reason why I love cherries! Cherry filling in between soft chocolate cake with a cherry on top of delectable frosting...Man, I need some right now...

I might make it a point to try the Dianda's in the Mission. Hell, I knew they had one in the Mission for a while now. Just never would think about buying Italian pastries in the middle of the Mission. I'm thinking more along the lines of burritos and cow brain tacos and horchata when I am out here...

excerpts: I had a slice of the rum cake which was raved about and the black forest.

So with the black forest the center was filled w/some processed jelly that they also use on their pies and canned cherries, the cake itself was dry and the whipped cream was fake and not made from real cream.

So with the black forest the center was filled w/some processed jelly that they also use on their pies and canned cherries, the cake itself was dry and the whipped cream was fake and not made from real cream.
The rum cake was made with the same fake whipped cream also and what tasted like those custard powder that you mix w/water to get instant custard, the cake part itself was ok.
I had really expected more from this bakery w/the 4 1/2 stars they were given, and was sadly dissapointed.
I didn't try anything else, but I don't expect the quality of the product to be any better.
The rum cake was made with the same fake whipped cream also and what tasted like those custard powder that you mix w/water to get instant custard, the cake part itself was ok.
I had really expected more from this bakery w/the 4 1/2 stars they were given, and was sadly dissapointed.
I didn't try anything else, but I don't expect the quality of the product to be any better.
I did weigh the fact that their cake slices were $3.75 and maybe i shouldn't be expecting too much, but still w/a 4 1/2 star I expected a bit more,
oh heck.... a lot more.

I hope w/all the customers they are getting that they are making enough profit to go towards using more natural, fresh ingredients and start making their stuff from scratch rather then relying on canned and processed ingredients.
For those of you who love this place, more power to you, I hope you give them continued success and they give you the "yummy" cake
you so love and
at some point in the future they will reward you w/high quality ingredients and even yummier cakes.
black forest.author: joshua g.
black forest.review: Oh thank god I read some recent reviews that agreed with my thoughts on this bakery, i thought i had lost my taste bud for a second there.  I have no idea why this place have 4 1/2 stars, while other more superior bakeries that uses all natural and organic ingredients have 4 or 3 1/2 stars.  I had a slice of the rum cake which was raved about and the black forest.  So with the black forest the center was filled w/some processed jelly that they also use on their pies and canned cherries, the cake itself was dry and the whipped cream was fake and not made from real cream.  The rum cake was made with the same fake whipped cream also and what tasted like those custard powder that you mix w/water to get instant custard, the cake part itself was ok.  I had really expected more from this bakery w/the 4 1/2 stars they were given, and was sadly dissapointed.  I didn't try anything else, but I don't expect the quality of the product to be any better.  I did weigh the fact that their cake slices were $3.75 and maybe i shouldn't be expecting too much, but still w/a 4 1/2 star I expected a bit more, oh heck.... a lot more.  I hope w/all the customers they are getting that they are making enough profit to go towards using more natural, fresh ingredients and start making their stuff from scratch rather then relying on canned and processed ingredients.  For those of you who love this place, more power to you, I hope you give them continued success and they give you the "yummy" cake you so love and at some point in the future they will reward you w/high quality ingredients and even yummier cakes.

excerpts: I was picking up a pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving and couldn't resist one of their chocolate banana pastries for myself, it was unbelievably good.
chocolate banana.author: Manny F.
chocolate banana.review:
I try to avoid Dianda's. If I came here regularly it would kill me so I only come here for special occasions. 

I was picking up a pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving and couldn't resist one of their chocolate banana pastries for myself, it was unbelievably good.

excerpts: , I can't order an entire St. Honore cake in order to devour it at home.
cake.author: Ed U.
cake.review:
This old-school bakery makes a very good first impression the moment you walk in the front door because all their freshly baked confections are all on display at once (photo: http://bit.ly/2QeGrUa). It's kinda like "The Bachelor" where all the women are gorgeous as they present themselves in revealing evening gowns to the vacuous single guy, but then they open their mouths and well... So I've been on calorie alert for a while, so as tempting as it would be, I can't order an entire St. Honore cake in order to devour it at home.

I was strolling on Mission and smacking my lips thinking something sweet would be nice. I zeroed in on their cookies where my eyes bugged out at the sight of the Amaretti with Pinoli (Amaretto Cookies with Pine Nuts) (photo: http://bit.ly/2wQvdMI). Two of those, please. And tilting my stare to the left, I saw the tray of Almond Lunghini (Italian Almond Cookies) (photo: http://bit.ly/2M8Cm0s). One of those, please. OK, I need to stop now. Three cookies for $3.75 seems s tad high but who cares? You should leave the gun, take the amaretti. Tutti a tavola a mangiare!

COOKIES - 4 stars...delizioso!
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...nowhere to sit but such a nice place to browse
SERVICE - 4 stars...no-nonsense
TOTAL - 4 stars...has Lidia and Grandma been here?

RELATED - Need to satisfy a sweet tooth? Here's a list of places I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2KaTJwA

excerpts: This time it was the rum cake and
Federetti which is an almond cake with chocolate mousse covered in chocolate.
Heaven!
cake.author: Sunil R.
cake.review:
Awesome store!! This place has Italian ladies who make the pastries...this is the real deal. 

I picked up some tiramisu and napoleon cakes. It was so good, I went back a few days later. This time it was the rum cake and Federetti which is an almond cake with chocolate mousse covered in chocolate. Heaven!

excerpts: I got a slice of the tres leches pineapple cake and another pastry.
The tres leches was a bit stale and was not milky like other cakes I've had.
I don't mind supporting small businesses but that was pretty pricey in my opinion especially for a below average cake.
cake.author: Sherluna V.
cake.review:
I got a slice of the tres leches pineapple cake and another pastry. The tres leches was a bit stale and was not milky like other cakes I've had. 2/5 

I'm not sure on the pastry's name but it had a yellow custard inside it and was flaky on the outside. This was actually pretty good. 4/5 

For just those two items, it was $9.50. I don't mind supporting small businesses but that was pretty pricey in my opinion especially for a below average cake.

excerpts:
3.5 STARS 

As I was waiting to pay for a cake:

Guy:
*Points at wedding cake topper
Our intern was leaving and our secretary found out her fav cake was Tres Leches Cake.
After a quick search on Yelp, I found that Dianda's was highly praised for their Tres Leches Cake.
So, if the cake order is simple, you may not have to call in 3 days in advance.
I ordered a Mango Tres Leches Cake which was $37.75 and feeds 8-10 people: http://bit.ly/2mRQRLj.
The 3 layers of leche: milk soaked sponge cake, custard, and whipped cream was rich and sweet but the mangos were slightly tart so everything kind of balanced out:
Not really my style as the soaked sponge cake tastes just like it sounds, like a wet sponge but for those who like tres leches
, I'm sure they'll feel differently.
cake.author: Cherylynn N.
cake.review:
3.5 STARS 

As I was waiting to pay for a cake:

Guy: "I think we should get married."

*Points at wedding cake topper*

Woman: "Awww, really?!"

Me *thinking*: "GUUUURRRLLLL, LOCK IT DOWN! LOCK. IT. DOWN!!!!!"

Ok, I know what some of you are thinking: Who proposes in a bakery...without a ring?!

For those who have dated commitment phobic men, you know what's up.

Forget the 2 carat minimum, I'll gladly take the ring from the gum ball machine! 

I don't know if he was being serious, but if he was...good to luck to the happy couple. 

Our intern was leaving and our secretary found out her fav cake was Tres Leches Cake. After a quick search on Yelp, I found that Dianda's was highly praised for their Tres Leches Cake. The cakes aren't fancy, they're old school, Aqua Net style but seem to be a crowd pleaser. 

Cakes orders require a 3 days' notice but I called in 2 days prior and they accepted my order. So, if the cake order is simple, you may not have to call in 3 days in advance. A deposit is required for all orders.  

I ordered a Mango Tres Leches Cake which was $37.75 and feeds 8-10 people: http://bit.ly/2mRQRLj. The 3 layers of leche: milk soaked sponge cake, custard, and whipped cream was rich and sweet but the mangos were slightly tart so everything kind of balanced out: http://bit.ly/2FUo5m3. 

Not really my style as the soaked sponge cake tastes just like it sounds, like a wet sponge but for those who like tres leches, I'm sure they'll feel differently. My co-workers said, they liked it (or maybe they didn't want to hurt my feelings).   

For cakes, my preferences are Fancy Wheat Field Bakery (San Bruno Avenue), Schubert's (Clement Street), Ambrosia Bakery (Ocean Avenue), and Tartine (Guerrero Street).

They spelled our intern's name wrong so I suggest asking them to repeat the spelling twice just to make extra sure. 

If anyone has another recs from Dianda's, kindly send them along. Maybe, I'll even see another "proposal"!

excerpts: They have a huge variety of cake and cookie flavors.
I got the tres leches cake slice and it didnt taste like tres leches at all.
I was disappointed because it looked really good!
It wasnt moist at all and sort of tasted like it was from a grocery store.
I would give the place another try and try a different flavor though!
cake.author: Auriyon J.
cake.review: They have a huge variety of cake and cookie flavors. I got the tres leches cake slice and it didnt taste like tres leches at all. I was disappointed because it looked really good! It wasnt moist at all and sort of tasted like it was from a grocery store. I would give the place another try and try a different flavor though!

excerpts: I got the cappuccino chocolate cake.
It's 46 dollars for the smallest one.
I personally think the chocolate chocolate cake was the best.
The best cake is at Dianda's   Highly recommended!
cake.author: Ivory B.
cake.review:
This place serves REAL cakes!   

I had to wait in line for 30 minutes but it's totally worth it.

I got the cappuccino chocolate cake.  It's 46 dollars for the smallest one. I personally think the chocolate chocolate cake was the best.  The almond tort and the almond cookies are also my favorite.

Love this Italian bakery. It's a true gem in the Mission district.

Parking around the bakery is tough. Make sure you put enough coins in the meter so you won't have to pay for the parking ticket. The metermaid is circulating around this area very often!

The best cake is at Dianda's   Highly recommended!

cake.author: Rod M.
cake.review:
Never had heard of this place and I didn't have it bookmarked either but I saw a bunch of people inside so I decided to hop in....

Three popular items are: 

Napoleon -made by sandwiching crispy layers of puff pastry with a rich custard pastry cream filling. This dish was amazing !! I liked this considerably more than the almond tort. First time trying it. 
Almond tort- was not my thing. Def liked Napoleon more and I'm sure I'm sure I would have liked the cannoli more.
Canolli looked good but didn't try it

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

excerpts: The fedoretti which is in the refrigerated section - a cake coated in chocolate and oozing with richness is to die for.
The dulce de leche and other cakes are simple but am sure they're amazing too.
Dianda's is worth many visits when in the city and especially around the Mission where good food is plentiful and a true commonality.
cake.author: Kinjal N.
cake.review:
Dianda's is located a few steps away from the 26th street Mission BART Station and is just a gem when it comes to Italian pastries and sweets. Their best items are still their almond cookies - especially the ones with the pinolas or pine nuts. Yum. 
The fedoretti which is in the refrigerated section - a cake coated in chocolate and oozing with richness is to die for. The dulce de leche and other cakes are simple but am sure they're amazing too. Dianda's is worth many visits when in the city and especially around the Mission where good food is plentiful and a true commonality.

excerpts: Not too sweet and the cake wasn't dry either.
cake.author: Wendy H.
cake.review:
Someone brought in their world famous almond torte at work.  OMG it was a slice of heaven.  Not too sweet and the cake wasn't dry either.  They were very generous with the almond as well.

Dianda's makes the best pastries!

excerpts: A small cake 4-6 servings $55.00.
If you don't order in advance,  they will pull out a frozen one if they have it
( make you feel like you should be grateful
you're even getting one).
The same as their eclairs if not out one from the freezer.
The prices are just not worth the quality it use to be.
To bad.
cake.author: Myra A.
cake.review:
Unfortunately, this isn't the Dianda's we I have known and loved as an institution of Italian American pastries in the Mission. 
If you remember this place from years ago and the original owners,  then you know what I'm talking about. This place isn't bad, but not as good as, it was before. The prices have sky rocketed. I mean $19.00 for a lb of wedding cookies. Last year their Almond raspberry torte was $14.25 today it was $19.25 a $5.00 hike in one year. The cakes they are known for, if not ordered in advance,  then you are out of luck. I mean these cakes were what put them on the map. 
A small cake 4-6 servings $55.00. If you don't order in advance,  they will pull out a frozen one if they have it ( make you feel like you should be grateful you're even getting one).  The same as their eclairs if not out one from the freezer.  The prices are just not worth the quality it use to be. To bad.

excerpts: My husband ordered for me a freshly made dulce de leche cake.
I ordered for my husband's fortieth a banana cake with vanilla frosting and filling.
Their pastries and sliced cakes are out of this world.
Thank you for the memories.
cake.author: Petite M.
cake.review: Scrumptious. Mouth-watering. Perfect. My husband ordered for me a freshly made dulce de leche cake. I ordered for my husband's fortieth a banana cake with vanilla frosting and filling. Their pastries and sliced cakes are out of this world.  Thank you for the memories.

excerpts: If there's one thing I know it's cake.
I love cake.
I love cake more than wine, whiskey, cheese, books, breakfast, a parking spot in SF, and the color pink.
The St Honore cake everyone raves about is good.
The Italian cherries are lovely, the depth of chocolate is really nice, the boozy levels are too high for me.
This is a difficult cake to make for the home baker when you take apart the individual technical merits/skill level you need coupled with the price of the quality ingredients this cake demands.
Reminds me of making an Opera cake.
This is a stunner and others who like punchy obvious flavors in their mouth will love, no, worship this cake!
Let me steer you to what is easily the most elegant non-European cake I have had the pleasure of eating more than one slice in a sitting.
The Banana Tres Leches cake.
Fresh bananas, wonderfully fluffy whipped cream, cake with a firm but tender crumb (to stand up to the soaking), and a base layer soaked in cream that isn't flimsy
/doesn't fall apart.
This cake is a visual and gastronomical delight!
The perfume of fresh bananas, the fatty cream and whipped cream, coupled with the texture of the cake make this the perfect choice for a special event (or if you are like me, a weekday)
If all that cake-loving talk wasn't enough praise, the cookies!
I love Stella D'oro cookies from the market.
I like the circles with pink or white frosting.
Cheesy?
Yes.
Throwback to my childhood?
They completely justify my love for cake and everything that requires butter, flour sugar, eggs, leavening, and an oven.
You can phone same day to order a cake for pick-up.
My family did.
It was easy peasy perfect!
cake.author: Jennifer C P.
cake.review:
If there's one thing I know it's cake. 

I mean I know a lot about a lot of things but the one thing in this entire universe I am so super confident about in my real world experience of eating, making, baking, gifting and being gifted ...cakes would be it. 

I love cake. I love cake more than wine, whiskey, cheese, books, breakfast, a parking spot in SF, and the color pink. 

That is a LOT of love! 

The St Honore cake everyone raves about is good. The Italian cherries are lovely, the depth of chocolate is really nice, the boozy levels are too high for me. This is a difficult cake to make for the home baker when you take apart the individual technical merits/skill level you need coupled with the price of the quality ingredients this cake demands. Reminds me of making an Opera cake. Same demands on ones skill, time, and cost per slice. 

SOLUTION: BUY IT HERE!! My personal taste in no way reflects badly on the quality. It's definitely there. This is a stunner and others who like punchy obvious flavors in their mouth will love, no, worship this cake! 

But for those of us with refined, discerning taste. Let me steer you to what is easily the most elegant non-European cake I have had the pleasure of eating more than one slice in a sitting.

The Banana Tres Leches cake. 

Fresh bananas, wonderfully fluffy whipped cream, cake with a firm but tender crumb (to stand up to the soaking), and a base layer soaked in cream that isn't flimsy/doesn't fall apart. This cake is a visual and gastronomical delight!

The perfume of fresh bananas, the fatty cream and whipped cream, coupled with the texture of the cake make this the perfect choice for a special event (or if you are like me, a weekday) This doesn't keep so order a size that you will completely finish in a day.

If all that cake-loving talk wasn't enough praise, the cookies! I love Stella D'oro cookies from the market. I like the circles with pink or white frosting. Cheesy? Yes. Throwback to my childhood? You bet!

The same flavor can be found in the cookies here. Better quality cookie, more tender crumb, lovely Italian cherries, chocolate, and or nuts grace the individual varietals. Get a pound of cookies, brew some coffee, and take some time out of life to savor your alone time. 

I still grab a bag of Stella D'oro's when I see them but let's not tell lies here. That slide out box of store bought cookies pales in comparison to the freshly baked deliciousness the cookie case here boasts. 

I just love sweets. My gosh. 

I love this bakery. They completely justify my love for cake and everything that requires butter, flour sugar, eggs, leavening, and an oven. 

Five stars - well done!

PS: You can phone same day to order a cake for pick-up. My family did. It was easy peasy perfect!

excerpts: My childhood cake place, always a cake from here for my birthday, lately it's been hit and miss, the product doesn't seem or taste fresh, dried out cakes and the prices are gong up, up up.

Perfect sweetness, not too sweet and fluffy moist cake with a light whip filling  perfection

cake.review: We normally order the famous Dianda cake with cream puffs but this time we ordered chocolate cake with banana filling and OMG was it the best!!! Perfect sweetness, not too sweet and fluffy moist cake with a light whip filling  perfection

excerpts: I love their 3 leches cake yumm!
But they need to expand their flavors.
How about kiwi?
Either way highly recommend!
cake.author: Rosana C.
cake.review: I love their 3 leches cake yumm! But they need to expand their flavors. How about kiwi? Either way highly recommend!

excerpts: I was walking in the area and remembered that they were known for their tres leches cake.
They were out
but I put in an order for a few slices to pick up tomorrow - yes
, you can put in an order to reserve just one slice of cake.
Sadly the cake was completely unrecognizable as a tres leches cake.
Fluffy cake, light whipped cream frosting.
But where are the tres leches?
The cake was not soaked in any liquid at all and BTW the whipped cream doesn't count as one of the tres.
I tried a few bites then was turning the box around trying to look for the name to make sure I got the right cake.
The order receipt looks like it could have 'pineapple 3 leche'.
Looking over other yelp reviews it seems like this is indeed the worst tres leches cake.
cake.author: Jean K.
cake.review:
Super nice ladies! And they have a great variety of cakes, pastries, cookies, etc. I was walking in the area and remembered that they were known for their tres leches cake. They were out but I put in an order for a few slices to pick up tomorrow - yes, you can put in an order to reserve just one slice of cake. 

And the slices were boxed up for right on time today. Sadly the cake was completely unrecognizable as a tres leches cake. Fluffy cake, light whipped cream frosting. But where are the tres leches? The cake was not soaked in any liquid at all and BTW the whipped cream doesn't count as one of the tres. I tried a few bites then was turning the box around trying to look for the name to make sure I got the right cake. The order receipt looks like it could have 'pineapple 3 leche'. Looking over other yelp reviews it seems like this is indeed the worst tres leches cake.

However, the Italian cakes are on point and really good.

excerpts:
The price is about $35 for a cake.

This location has a loading zone to park in front since it's on mission st which is very busy.
The staff was friendly.
That accept card here.
Check it out!

but then again it is in sf!

cake.review: Loveeee this bakery!! The thousand layers cake is the best! Have to call in and order a day before for it. The quality is good and price is decent! Only down side is parking! Very hard to find parking on mission but then again it is in sf!

excerpts: I've gotten my bday cake here since an infant
now I get my children's cakes here.
I recommend the rum cake with the custard balls it is amazing
