cake.review: I've gotten my bday cake here since an infant now I get my children's cakes here. I recommend the rum cake with the custard balls it is amazing

excerpts: Honore cake, don't miss it,unforgettable experience!
cake.author: Bridget R.
cake.review:
Best bakery in SF. Everything is beyond delicious. Hope to visit soon.
If they still have the St.Honore cake, don't miss it,unforgettable experience!

excerpts: The cake itself is super almondy, and it's fairly light but moist.
cake.author: Marilyn H.
cake.review:
I got to try their almond torte, and it was awesome. I'm a big fan of marzipan and anything almond.

The crust is a very thin pastry crust, and then there's a thin layer of raspberry jam.  The cake itself is super almondy, and it's fairly light but moist.  The texture is great.

This is one of my favorite almond tortes.

excerpts: Ever since I can remember my family has been getting dianda's cake.
I honestly will never get tired of eating their cakes for my birthday.
It has become a tradition for my family to always come here for birthdays.
I even try to introduce it to my close friends and every time they have tried their cakes they want more.
My usual must try is the chocolate chocolate.
I eat this for basically all my birthdays.
Another cake that comes in second is the tres leeches just because I'm
Spanish and love tres leeches.
They have other cakes like pineapples and strawberries + more fruity ones.
The staff is always super friendly and bilingual!
Cakes do range from 35 dollars + and single slices around 4 dollars.
The wait isn't too long and they have the cakes ready for you to pick up and write whatever on it that you would like.
It is really hard to find parking because it is on the mission
but sometimes you can get lucky with meter parking!
Overall best Italian cake in SF And one of the best cakes I've tried period.
cake.author: Leslie F.
cake.review: Ever since I can remember my family has been getting dianda's cake. I honestly will never get tired of eating their cakes for my birthday. It has become a tradition for my family to always come here for birthdays. I even try to introduce it to my close friends and every time they have tried their cakes they want more. My usual must try is the chocolate chocolate. I eat this for basically all my birthdays. Another cake that comes in second is the tres leeches just because I'm Spanish and love tres leeches. They have other cakes like pineapples and strawberries + more fruity ones. The staff is always super friendly and bilingual! Cakes do range from 35 dollars + and single slices around 4 dollars. The wait isn't too long and they have the cakes ready for you to pick up and write whatever on it that you would like. It is really hard to find parking because it is on the mission but sometimes you can get lucky with meter parking! Overall best Italian cake in SF And one of the best cakes I've tried period.

excerpts: They are famous for the into an desserts, mainly this cream puff cake they make.
I haven't had it
but it looks and sounds amazing!!
You must try this place!!
It's incredible!!
cake.author: Vicki K.
cake.review: A wonderful surprise! This is a cute little bakery, tucked away in a small strip mall near crystal springs. It's small and quaint. The service is fast. The desserts are delicious!!! Their Napoleon is the best I've had in all of California!! They are famous for the into an desserts, mainly this cream puff cake they make. I haven't had it but it looks and sounds amazing!! You must try this place!! It's incredible!!

excerpts: Okay, there is one slice you MUST GET, it's what they're known for...the RUM cake.
Ay mama!!!
cake.author: Monica B.
cake.review: My family has enjoyed Dianda's for over 40 years (I've included a picture to prove it)!!!Did I just date myself??!! They have a such a delicious assortment of fresh pastries to choose from and honestly, I can't say any one choice is better than the other because you simply can't go wrong with anything. Okay, there is one slice you MUST GET, it's what they're known for...the RUM cake. Ay mama!!!

excerpts:
Best Italian cake in California!

A slice of cake is now $4.25 which is probably not expensive to the influx of techies who moved into the Mission, but it hits the pockets of the loyal natives who have been there since day 1. 

Basically your average cake for 15 people is around $25, but Dianda's could set you back $45-$70 depending on what cake you get. 
It wasn't the same cake I'm used to.
cake.author: Angela B.
cake.review:
Best Italian cake in California!

You have to taste it to understand why this bakery is so good​ and expensive.

Cakes can range from $40-100+.

A slice of cake is now $4.25 which is probably not expensive to the influx of techies who moved into the Mission, but it hits the pockets of the loyal natives who have been there since day 1. 

Small families can't afford expensive cakes. It's also the size. Basically your average cake for 15 people is around $25, but Dianda's could set you back $45-$70 depending on what cake you get. They go from a 12 inch round to massive cakes.

Best cakes.
Strawberry. However, the last time I got a slice, the strawberries seemed hard . There was something different. It wasn't the same cake I'm used to.

Banana.
Lemon
Pineapple.
Chocolate.

They have a new flavor: tres leches and pineapple. Hmmmmmm. Not sure. Will have to try that another time.

I think it's the whipped cream, too. It's soft, moist and tasty.

Dianda's get 5 stars for taste, but 3 for pricing.

excerpts: Their St. Honore cake is the only cake one of my bf's will have for her birthday.
Their rum cake is the only cake my man actually likes.
Really, he's just not a cake guy.
But Dianda's rum cake?
They were sold out of rum cake.
So we got Mexican wedding cookies, almond coconut cookies, & the almond puff pastries that look like mini biscotti.
cake.author: Veronica M.
cake.review:
Dianda's is another member of the old school SF bakery family.  Victoria, Schubert's, Stella, Dianda's.  The bakery where every SF native (especially if they're Italian) goes for their cakes & cannoli.  I love Tartine, but that's not where they're going to go for cannoli, you know what I mean?  We're talking old school.

Their St. Honore cake is the only cake one of my bf's will have for her birthday.

Their rum cake is the only cake my man actually likes.  Really, he's just not a cake guy.  But Dianda's rum cake?  He's all over it.

Anything w almond they do like poetry.  The almond torte has a HUGE following.  Apparently, the tradition is every Christmas you ship this almond torte out to your loved ones.  So, what I want to know is...where's my Christmas almond torte?  I've never received one...?!  I'd like an almond torte via special delivery...who wouldn't?

Naturally, I've lamented this to my man.  So I should be getting one delivered to me right before December 25th.  

They were sold out of rum cake.  So we got Mexican wedding cookies, almond coconut cookies, & the almond puff pastries that look like mini biscotti.  With one fedoretti.

The fedoretti...
an almond pastry base topped w a chocolate rum cream & covered in chocolate.  It's wonderful.  We noshed it before we got to the car.

On the way out, I spotted the patty cakes & the strawberry rolls.  The patty cakes are chocolate cakes filled w whipped cream and covered in chocolate.  That just sounds amazing to me.  2 of my favorite things together in one heavenly piece of work.  The strawberry roll looks positively dreamy.  

Next time.  
It's on.

Over 50 years old & still a must do.

5 stars.

excerpts: Tried a chocolate rum cake from Dianda's and it was absolutely amazing.
You couldn't feel too much rum in it but just a hint of it's taste.
Would definetly recommend trying out.
cake.author: Gaurav N.
cake.review: Tried a chocolate rum cake from Dianda's and it was absolutely amazing. You couldn't feel too much rum in it but just a hint of it's taste. Would definetly recommend trying out.

Wonderful selection and tastes are out of this world!!
Great customer service too!!
cake.author: Janet G.
cake.review: Cake boss has nothing on this bakery!!  Wonderful selection and tastes are out of this world!!  Great customer service too!!

excerpts: I haven't sampled the famous rum cake.
cake.author: Tim P.
cake.review: Wow. I feel fortunate to live a block from this place. Tasty cookies and quality cannoli. I haven't sampled the famous rum cake.

excerpts: I've never heard of this cake before and was pleasantly surprised how yummy!
cake.author: Nicole D.
cake.review:
My colleague requested the St. Honore as her special (office) birthday treat and it was terrific!   mmmmm, me love me some custard!     It was the perfect size, beautifully decorated and arrived in a timely matter.   I've never heard of this cake before and was pleasantly surprised how yummy!

The delivery fee is $20 but was well worth not having to leave the office to get it.

excerpts: so I decided to surprise him with a birthday cake from Dianda's.
They were so helpful over the phone, picking the most incredible cake.
It was ready right on time and while I was there I even got myself a little personal size cake for later.
The whole office was raving about this cake
it was a huge hit!
cake.author: Chris C.
cake.review: My boss is Italian so I decided to surprise him with a birthday cake from Dianda's. They were so helpful over the phone, picking the most incredible cake. It was whip cream with Mango. It was ready right on time and while I was there I even got myself a little personal size cake for later.  The whole office was raving about this cake it was a huge hit!

excerpts: Honestly never heard of this place until my friend asked me to help her pick up the cake
I was in and out of there within 10 minutes, on top of them writing something in frosting on the cake!
Now, I didn't get to try their other baked goods but the strawberry short cake is to DIE for!
It is so moist and filled with fresh strawberries and soft whipped cream all around.
Please, you just have to get it!
cake.author: Coco L.
cake.review:
Honestly never heard of this place until my friend asked me to help her pick up the cake but wow, I've definitely been living under a rock....

This bakery is located in the Mission so be mindful about how tough parking can get as the streets get pretty busy. Metered street parking all around but there is residential parking if you're willing to walk a bit. 

I noticed that you're supposed to take a number in order to get helped faster(?) but there was no more numbers left to take when I got there lol. Regardless, the service was fast and extremely helpful! I was in and out of there within 10 minutes, on top of them writing something in frosting on the cake! 

Now, I didn't get to try their other baked goods but the strawberry short cake is to DIE for! It is so moist and filled with fresh strawberries and soft whipped cream all around. Please, you just have to get it!

excerpts: Stopped by for a tiramisu cake for the holidays.
Cake was good, but the service was poor.
We asked for writing on the cake, and the associate took it to the back to write.
He then boxed the cake without even asking us to take a look.
When we asked to see it, we found out that he really messed up the writing.
The writing was illegible, not completely frosted, and left icing-less holes in the cake.
His excuse was that the cake was hard and it wasn't easy to put frosting on it--- which I'm not sure if thats referring to his poor handwriting or the holes in the cake...
I would give the place 3.5 stars for the cake, - 2.5 stars for the bad service.
cake.author: James S.
cake.review:
Stopped by for a tiramisu cake for the holidays. Cake was good, but the service was poor. We asked for writing on the cake, and the associate took it to the back to write. He then boxed the cake without even asking us to take a look. When we asked to see it, we found out that he really messed up the writing. The writing was illegible, not completely frosted, and left icing-less holes in the cake. His excuse was that the cake was hard and it wasn't easy to put frosting on it--- which I'm not sure if thats referring to his poor handwriting or the holes in the cake...

He then kept rushing and badgering us asking for us to pay with cash. We had to ask twice before he would use a credit card. After that we wanted to get some cookies, and he made us pay for them separately in cash. 

I would give the place 3.5 stars for the cake, - 2.5 stars for the bad service.

excerpts: My coworker ordered a cake from them for our annual Lunar new year lunch.

The cake was frozen, only part of the cake had rum on it, the wording was not centered and who ever decorated the cake obviously think it was ok to be sloppy by correcting the color that was on top of one of the cream puff by smudging the correct color on top of the wrong one.
Disappointed by this experience...

cake.review:

Was going to a friend's for Christmas Eve, so decided to order one.
Was worth the difficult parking, and line of people.
Was "hands down" the best cake I've ever had.
cake.author: Lynn G.
cake.review: I've been to Dianda's many times, but never tried the St. Honore cake. Was going to a friend's for Christmas Eve, so decided to order one. Was worth the difficult parking, and line of people. Was "hands down" the best cake I've ever had. Rum custard, whipped cream, oh my! Everyone loved it! Can't wait until my birthday!! Dianda's is amazing!!!

excerpts: This is definitely not a tres leches cake .
I was saddened to have all my hope and dreams crushed by this dry cake.
This is more like a yellow cake with some whip cream and some fruit filling in the middle.
Sad!
cake.author: Selena H.
cake.review: Tres leches? This is definitely not a tres leches cake . I was saddened to have all my hope and dreams crushed by this dry cake. This is more like a yellow cake with some whip cream and some fruit filling in the middle. Sad!

excerpts: I recommend the St Honroe cake!
I get those cakes for work when it's a farewell occasion!
cake.author: Pooh W.
cake.review: I love this place nice cakes and all kinds of good Italian pasties in the heart of the Mission. My family enjoyed this place for years, the staff is super friendly and I always get my cakes on point ! I recommend the St Honroe cake! I get those cakes for work when it's a farewell occasion!

excerpts: HONORE cake is and will be the best cake I've ever had.
One time my husband
and I purchased their small $40 round of St. Honore just to take home and enjoy.
No birthdays, no occasion.
If i lived closer this would be my husbands and my birthday cake every year.
cake.author: Chrissie G.
cake.review:
I can't believe i haven't reviewed this place. My mother in law introduced me to this deliciousness about 9 years ago and still love their pastries. 

i took away stars because their workers are RUDE AS HECK!!!!! You ask them what flavor things are and they give you the attitude and the stare. It would help if they had labels on their cases. But their pissy attitude hasn't and will not stop me from getting my Dianda fix. 

ST. HONORE cake is and will be the best cake I've ever had. One time my husband and I purchased their small $40 round of St. Honore just to take home and enjoy. No birthdays, no occasion. If i lived closer this would be my husbands and my birthday cake every year. 

I suggest people not care about their poor customer service and just try their pastries. It has gotten pricier over the years but you will not be disappointed.

excerpts: I went yesterday to order a cake for my sons birthday, I was told by a friend that they make delicious cakes and had what I was looking for... a custom cake.
First I called and ask if they could do that and
the lady over the phone said yeAh just bring the picture and we will do it...
I went over an immediately saw a lady arguing with a customer and she was very rude...
when it was my turn i told her that i spoke to someone over the phone basically 40min ago

excerpts: ive always had a cake from here.
Super yummy!
cake.author: Kristy G.
cake.review: My family and I have been buying our cakes from here for years now, since I was a kid ive always had a cake from here. Super yummy!

excerpts: Millefiori is the cake I look for any excuse to buy.
A birthday, communion, barmitzvah, kid lost their first tooth whatever.
It's flaky like baklava and filled with a fresh cream.
Take it to your girlfriends parents the first time you meet 'em, tell 'em it's a Italian specialty cake
cake.author: Greg Poupon M.
cake.review: Millefiori is the cake I look for any excuse to buy. A birthday, communion, barmitzvah, kid lost their first tooth whatever. It's flaky like baklava and filled with a fresh cream. Take it to your girlfriends parents the first time you meet 'em, tell 'em it's a Italian specialty cake

excerpts: If I needed to get a cake for a special occasion (e.g. birthdays etc), I would definitely go grab a cake from this place.
cake.author: Henry L.
cake.review:
Popular pastry shop right next to the Bart Mission-24 stop

This quaint little pastry store always seem to have more customers than there is space. The chocolate, cookies, and cakes all looked fresh and colorful, and the staff who work there all seem to be pretty nice. The price is ok--reasonable given the quality. I ordered the cherry and raspberry cookies, which were a bit dry, but hey, I expected cookies to be dry anyways :)

If I needed to get a cake for a special occasion (e.g. birthdays etc), I would definitely go grab a cake from this place.

excerpts: I was also so very fortunate to receive a St Honore Birthday cake for EVERY birthday.
They also sell Napoleons, which are my favorite,  tied with, of course, the St Honore Cake.
They also sell Cannoli's, slices of cakes, Tiramisu, cream puffs called "the clam", almond torte, and cream horns.
During Easter, they even sell the wonderful Hot Cross buns.
If there's a word that could describe something much more than DECADENT and/or SCRUMPTIOUS, Please tell me....
Because that would describe Diandra's.
Forget Schubert's or Victoria Pastry....
cake.author: Janet T.
cake.review:
I don't know why I would never have gotten to complete a review for an outstanding place of business that I have frequented many, many times in the past several years. And by all accounts, consider it my favorite bakery on the Planet...  DIANDRA'S ITALIAN AMERICAN  PASTRY.  It even has two locations. One  is in the Mission District, San Francisco (the most popular) and secondly the other location is in San Mateo (which is where I live now).  I've got Yelper buddy Cheryl S to remind me just how AMAZING this bakery really is, as she took her very first visit there just recently and is HOOKED. That's what this place does to you!  It also brings back many childhood memories for me.  My Mom use to always make us tag along as she would go shopping for dinner parties (she was an excellent cook) I can remember she always ended the shopping extravaganza with a stop at Diandra's.They have a huge selection of pastries, cakes, and cookies.  I was also so very fortunate to receive a St Honore Birthday cake for EVERY birthday.  Boy was that a TREAT!

To this very day, I find myself at Diandra's. Instead of bringing a bottle of wine for a dinner welcome gift, I usually stop at Diandra's and pick up a box of cookies, which they sell by the half of pound. They are like gourmet cookies. They also sell Napoleons, which are my favorite,  tied with, of course, the St Honore Cake.  They also sell Cannoli's, slices of cakes, Tiramisu, cream puffs called "the clam", almond torte, and cream horns.  During Easter, they even sell the wonderful Hot Cross buns. If there's a word that could describe something much more than DECADENT and/or SCRUMPTIOUS, Please tell me.... Because that would describe Diandra's.  Forget Schubert's or Victoria Pastry....  Diandra's is truly a GEM!  

YES they are expensive, the ladies behind the counter ROCK. But ohhhhhh... So worth it.

Try it, you won't like it..... you'll absoultely LOVE it.  Ask my friend Cheryl.

excerpts: I have tried the tres leches cake from here
and it is my absolute favorite!
Today we were hoping to buy a piece but they were already sold out.
cake.author: Jeannette C.
cake.review: I have tried the tres leches cake from here and it is my absolute favorite! Today we were hoping to buy a piece but they were already sold out. So we went ahead a tried a new flavor a banana cream. Omg... it was delicious! Seem like you can't go wrong with any flavor. And did I mention the price for a slice? Only $4.50 you can not beat it!

excerpts: The rum cake is my favorite, but the banana and chocolate is also so good.
Cookies and canolis are amazing.
cake.author: Marlene M.
cake.review: Best Italian bakery in Northern CA. I've been coming here for over 20 years. The rum cake is my favorite, but the banana and chocolate is also so good. Cookies and canolis are amazing.

excerpts: If you want a special cake, I'd suggest the St. Honore cake which has rum balls all along the edges.
cake.author: Ana Marie L.
cake.review:
One of the best bakeries in SF! Been coming here since I was a kid. They have the best rum balls, napoleons, cakes, etc. If you want a special cake, I'd suggest the St. Honore cake which has rum balls all along the edges. 

Much easier to call and reserve cakes at Dianda's rather than other popular bakeries such as Schubert's etc., as the latter only takes orders on weekdays.

excerpts: Once upon a time I tasted the BEST thousand layer cake at Dianda's.
It was so delicious that after every bite I would close my eyes and savor this perfect pastry.
It been a long while since I had one until today.
I was utterly disappointed!
Something was off...
it had a very thin layer of whipped cream on top with very small chocolate shavings.
It needed more whipped cream so it can compliment the custard.
The custard was not the same either.
Not rich not delicate a bit bland.
Something changed from this thousand layer cake and not for the better.
If I remember correctly it may have had layers of whipped in between the custard layers and this one did not have any.
Unfortunately, I will have to live with the memory of what the thousand layer cake used to taste like at Dianda's because it is a distant memory.
cake.author: Review L.
cake.review: Once upon a time I tasted the BEST thousand layer cake at Dianda's. It was so delicious that after every bite I would close my eyes and savor this perfect pastry. It been a long while since I had one until today. I was utterly disappointed! Something was off...it had a very thin layer of whipped cream on top with very small chocolate shavings. It needed more whipped cream so it can compliment the custard. The custard was not the same either. Not rich not delicate a bit bland. Something changed from this thousand layer cake and not for the better. If I remember correctly it may have had layers of whipped in between the custard layers and this one did not have any. Unfortunately, I will have to live with the memory of what the thousand layer cake used to taste like at Dianda's because it is a distant memory.

excerpts: The cake is not too sweet -
it is perfect taste!!
cake.author: Pinarat S.
cake.review:
I really love this place. The cake is not too sweet -  it is perfect taste!! And the price is ok :) 

If you have a chance to visit around here. I would recommend to taste it....

I order this several times.

excerpts: I went in to pick up a cake for my coworker's birthday.
I specifically wanted tres Leches.
They had a variety of choices!
The cake was nice and moist.
Their custard was light and palpable.
The decoration on the cake is old fashioned but tasteful.
Over all I'd say I had a pleasant experience.
I think I'm lacking the nostalgia that others have for this place.
After all I'm an L.A. raised gal, but all in all 4 stars!
cake.author: Judith G.
cake.review:
My first time at Dianda's was yesterday. I went in to pick up a cake for my coworker's birthday. I specifically wanted tres Leches. They had a variety of choices! Strawberries, Pineapple, Banana, and even Mango! 

The cake was nice and moist. Their custard was light and palpable. I'm usually not a fan of custard so this is a high compliment. 

The decoration on the cake is old fashioned but tasteful. Over all I'd say I had a pleasant experience. I think I'm lacking the nostalgia that others have for this place. After all I'm an L.A. raised gal, but all in all 4 stars!

excerpts: The cannolis are still perfect, and the Napoleon is a revelation disguised as a cake.
Yeah sure, so the prices went up, so did everything else in the City.
Just be happy that this, and many places like it, still exist.
Places like this are what define San Francisco.
I hope that I can take my grandchildren to get their birthday cakes there just like my grandparents took me.
cake.author: Robert K.
cake.review: As the world changes around it, Dianda's stays true to form. I've been coming here for almost 30 years. The cannolis are still perfect, and the Napoleon is a revelation disguised as a cake. Yeah sure, so the prices went up, so did everything else in the City. Just be happy that this, and many places like it, still exist. Places like this are what define San Francisco. I hope that I can take my grandchildren to get their birthday cakes there just like my grandparents took me.

excerpts: This Is definitely one of the best places to get a cake from.
cake.author: Soraya M.
cake.review: We have gotten several birthday cakes from here since back when I was a kid in the 80's. Their Cakes are sooooooo yummy. This Is definitely one of the best places to get a cake from. The Napolean and rum cakes are the best I have ever had.

excerpts: Fantastic Italian run cake, always incredibly busy.
Impossible to park.
They really need a "curb delivery" option.
Driving around for 20 min and parking 4 blocks away when you have a heavy cake is really difficult.
I would love to give them my credit card over the phone and have them run the cake out...
cake.author: P K.
cake.review:
Fantastic Italian run cake, always incredibly busy.  Impossible to park. They really need a "curb delivery" option.  Driving around for 20 min and parking 4 blocks away when you have a heavy cake is really difficult. 

I would love to give them my credit card over the phone and have them run the cake out...

Do that and you'll get 2 more stars.

excerpts: Definitely their chocolate strawberry cake and their tiramisu, both of which were pretty fantastic.
Their banana cake?
Not bad, if you're into bananas, but I certainly prefer mine in pie form.
Their rum puff cake, alas, was a little disappointing.
cake.author: Johnny W.
cake.review:
My first experience (there have been several more since) with Dianda's was somewhat mixed. A coworker had brought in two large boxes with a selection of most of their cakes, and I, in my greed, decided it was wise to attempt to try every single one of them. Sugar, cream, and carb overload ensued twenty minutes later for this clever lactose-intolerant Asian.

Highlights? Definitely their chocolate strawberry cake and their tiramisu, both of which were pretty fantastic. Their banana cake? Not bad, if you're into bananas, but I certainly prefer mine in pie form. Their rum puff cake, alas, was a little disappointing.

Texture wise, their cakes are all of the sponge variety: so, nice and fluffy. Prices are also quite reasonable, given the portion sizes! A solid 3.5 stars.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Your typical bakery with display cases all around. Theirs are of the shorter variety, so one can easily see the top shelf, as they're roughly eye level, even while sitting. When they're busy, it does get a little cramped, but for the most part, maneuverability isn't an issue.

Bathroom - Pretty sure I didn't see any open to the public.

excerpts: If you look at the designs of the cake you can see that they look like cakes from the 1970s/80s.
Well, that's what they taste like too.
Their other pastries, again, outdated.
Scroll through the photos on yelp
and you'll see what I'm talking about.
I've tried this place three times just to give them a chance but Was left disappointed every time.
cake.author: Urban E.
cake.review: I don't know why this place has such high ratings. Their cakes are outdated and lacks that certain quality.   If you look at the designs of the cake you can see that they look like cakes from the 1970s/80s.  Well, that's what they taste like too. Their other pastries, again, outdated.  Scroll through the photos on yelp and you'll see what I'm talking about.  I've tried this place three times just to give them a chance but Was left disappointed every time.

excerpts: The run cake is amazing too!!!
Check it out!!!!!!!
cake.author: Taylor P.
cake.review: Went here twice with the girlfriend and we both loved it. They have a great selection to choose from and do custom orders too. The smell alone is worth the price of one of their awesome cannoli. The run cake is amazing too!!! Check it out!!!!!!!

excerpts: My mother called me last week to ask me what kind of cake I wanted for my birthday this year
and I specifically asked for a chocolate cake with strawberries from Dianda's.
She arrived early in the morning only to find out that the cake was not there.
First they told her that someone already picked it up which was impossible because only 2 people knew that the cake was there, myself and my mom.
Then they started interrogating her as if she was lying.
They asked her how big the cake was, how many servings it was, how much it was and so on.
I mean really?
I understand asking what kind of cake but to ask her the rest of the questions was unacceptable.
Then it finally occurs to them to look at the receipts and it looks like they gave our cake to someone else by mistake.
So after over 30 minutes of harassing my mom, they just grab another from the case, write on it and pack it.
There was no apology or discount for loosing our cake.
So a few hours later, here we are getting ready to cut the cake and my mom makes a comment to me that the strawberries look really old and dry
so I'm looking at it
and I see that the strawberries are moldy.
We then cut it open to see and the strawberries are equally as disgusting and they are brown and leaky.
The baker actually took the cake to the back to write on so they were fully aware that the fruit was old and moldy but yet chose to still sell it to us.
She tells her about the rotten cake and another clerk chimes in and actually says to us that it is no moldy.
My mom picks one of the strawberries up so they can take a closer look and one of them actually acknowledges that it is indeed moldy.
So the clerk tells me she is going to get me another cake
and I tell her that I don't want ANOTHER cake and that I just want a refund.
Also, it's not like I just didn't like the cake and want a refund even though they should refund your money or replace it under those circumstances too.
The cake was rotten for God's sake!
I told them that this was unacceptable and that after they lost my cake, harassed my mom for over 30 minutes in the morning that their solution was to replace my lost cake with a rotten one.

TWO trips across the city, dealing with the difficult parking, having my mom treated poorly for 30 minutes, a lost cake, a rotten cake, ending up with NO birthday cake, having to get really upset before getting a refund, having the money tossed at me like we were a piece of garbage AND me having to take 1.5 hours out of my birthday to deal with this.
Thank you so much for your generosity.
I don't know what I would do without that extra 25 whole cents.
cake.author: Diane M.
cake.review:
My family and I have been buying cakes and pastries here for probably over 30 years. We used to buy everything at their location on Green St in the North Beach and when they closed, we started buying at this location.

Unfortunately, this 30 year tradition ends today. My mother called me last week to ask me what kind of cake I wanted for my birthday this year and I specifically asked for a chocolate cake with strawberries from Dianda's.

My mom placed the order on Thursday for pick up on Sunday. She arrived early in the morning only to find out that the cake was not there. Instead of expressing concern and trying to make this right, they all decide to interrogate my mother and treat her like she's an idiot. 

First they told her that someone already picked it up which was impossible because only 2 people knew that the cake was there, myself and my mom. Then they started interrogating her as if she was lying. They asked her how big the cake was, how many servings it was, how much it was and so on. I mean really? I understand asking what kind of cake but to ask her the rest of the questions was unacceptable. 

Then they accused her of placing the order at the San Mateo location. My mom told them repeatedly that she did not. They did not believe her and they called over there anyway and low and behold, no such order was placed there.

Then it finally occurs to them to look at the receipts and it looks like they gave our cake to someone else by mistake. So after over 30 minutes of harassing my mom, they just grab another from the case, write on it and pack it. There was no apology or discount for loosing our cake.

So a few hours later, here we are getting ready to cut the cake and my mom makes a comment to me that the strawberries look really old and dry so I'm looking at it and I see that the strawberries are moldy. We then cut it open to see and the strawberries are equally as disgusting and they are brown and leaky. So we put all of it back into the box because the last thing I want to do is get sick and we go back to dianda's again. 

Also, there is no way that they didn't see this. The baker actually took the cake to the back to write on so they were fully aware that the fruit was old and moldy but yet chose to still sell it to us.

When we get there, my mom begins to talk to one of the ladies. She tells her about the rotten cake and another clerk chimes in and actually says to us that it is no moldy. My mom picks one of the strawberries up so they can take a closer look and one of them actually acknowledges that it is indeed moldy. So the clerk tells me she is going to get me another cake and I tell her that I don't want ANOTHER cake and that I just want a refund.

Another clerk chimes in and tells me that the manager is not in until tomorrow. I mean really!?! So you want us to come back a THIRD time? I live like 25 minutes away from here and tomorrow is Monday and people work. Also, it's not like I just didn't like the cake and want a refund even though they should refund your money or replace it under those circumstances too. The cake was rotten for God's sake! So that is when I started to talk and get really upset. 

I told them that this was unacceptable and that after they lost my cake, harassed my mom for over 30 minutes in the morning that their solution was to replace my lost cake with a rotten one. And that instead of being at home with my family celebrating my birthday, I'm here dealing with them.

All this time there was an older Italian lady with a really nasty attitude was just listening to what was going on even though I know she is affiliated with the owners and definitely had the authority to give me my money back. Because I was so upset, getting loud and customers were starting to listen, she finally stepped in and literally tossed the money at us and made a snarky remark that she gave us 25 cents more. WOW! 25 cents was totally worth TWO trips across the city, dealing with the difficult parking, having my mom treated poorly for 30 minutes, a lost cake, a rotten cake, ending up with NO birthday cake, having to get really upset before getting a refund, having the money tossed at me like we were a piece of garbage AND me having to take 1.5 hours out of my birthday to deal with this. Thank you so much for your generosity. I don't know what I would do without that extra 25 whole cents. What a bitch!

After 30 years of buying a ton of cakes, after recommending them to all my friends and family all of these years and being one of their biggest supporters, it's a shame that it had to end this way. I will never ever step foot in this place again and I have already begun reaching out to my network to tell them what happened to us and that I don't want them buying me and surprising me with anymore cakes from here.

Luckily, I live in SF where bakeries are a dime a dozen. Schubert's and Ambrosia are about to get a lot more business from us and I don't have to drive all the way out to the mission.

excerpts: My favorites are the St Honore cake with little eclairs filled with custard, the raspberry almond torte, the Zuppe Inglese rum soaked vake with custard filling between layers of flaky pastry, all their cookies and my favorite candy...caramele Rossana in the red wrapper, hard candy filled with a yummy sweet cream center.
cake.author: Mo B.
cake.review: Grew up celebrating our birthdays with delicious cakes and pastries from Dianda's Italian Bakery... Can't say enough about their variety of freshly baked cakes, pastries and cookies. My favorites are the St Honore cake with little eclairs filled with custard, the raspberry almond torte, the Zuppe Inglese rum soaked vake with custard filling between layers of flaky pastry, all their cookies and my favorite candy...caramele Rossana in the red wrapper, hard candy filled with a yummy sweet cream center.

excerpts: The rum cake slices are great too.
Truly a city gem and some of the best cakes you can get for birthdays.
If parking wasn't so horrible and Dianda's so far, I'd be here more often.
cake.author: Ry T.
cake.review:
Too bad they closed their North Beach bakery years ago.  You have to get down to the Mission for this place.  Love their puffed pastries.  So good, filled with custard, whipped cream and all sorts of flavors. The choc. eclair isn't so great 'tho and the creamed horn (with whipped cream) isn't too bad.  

The rum cake slices are great too.  Truly a city gem and some of the best cakes you can get for birthdays.   If parking wasn't so horrible and Dianda's so far, I'd be here more often.

excerpts: I love the patty cake.
The staff is also always really helpful.
I sort of hate that it's so close the Bart because I keep going in on my way home.
But that's on me.
cake.author: Adaobi N.
cake.review: I love the patty cake. The staff is also always really helpful. I sort of hate that it's so close the Bart because I keep going in on my way home. But that's on me.

excerpts: The Chocolate Rum Cake & Cannoli's are to die for!
My dad loves the chocolate rum cake....he drives to SF every year to get one for his birthday!
It's totally worth the drive!
My dad loves the chocolate rum cake....he drives to SF every year to get one for his birthday!
It's totally worth the drive!
cake.author: Manette S.
cake.review: The Chocolate Rum Cake & Cannoli's are to die for! My dad loves the chocolate rum cake....he drives to SF every year to get one for his birthday! It's totally worth the drive!

excerpts: Birthdays, Weddings, Graduations or just to buy a cake... they've always been bought here.
To say I love this place would be an understatement.
I'll keep this short and sweet like their Rum Cake cups.
Dianda's is hands down the best Bakery in San Francisco!
cake.author: Maria Francesca A.
cake.review: I have a personal connection to this bakery... Birthdays, Weddings, Graduations or just to buy a cake... they've always been bought here. To say I love this place would be an understatement. I'll keep this short and sweet like their Rum Cake cups. Dianda's is hands down the best Bakery in San Francisco!

excerpts: Coworker brought in a large cake from this ever popular Italian bakery in the Mission.
cake.author: Jana C.
cake.review:
Amazing, rich, creamy, and just a perfect slice of dessert! Coworker brought in a large cake from this ever popular Italian bakery in the Mission. A bit of a softer NY style, thick and dense, but generally a tad softer in the creamy center.

Not a huge fan of the profiteroles here, or the Italian cookies, however. It's more the texture for me.

excerpts: They have good rum cake too.
Just like the desserts the staff are really sweet people and are hard workers since they get really long lines sometimes so keep that in mo.
Tambien hablan español y siempre me acuerdo comiendo cookies de diandas cuando estaba chiquita con mis hermanos y comiendo los queques con my familia.
cake.author: Frances A.
cake.review: Love their cannolis, cakes, cupcakes, and every cookie (chocolate biscotti is bomb). They have good rum cake too. Just like the desserts the staff are really sweet people and are hard workers since they get really long lines sometimes so keep that in mo. Tambien hablan español y siempre me acuerdo comiendo cookies de diandas cuando estaba chiquita con mis hermanos y comiendo los queques con my familia.

excerpts: The original rum cake is pretty because the strawberry red color is the actual rum and it has custard in it.
Hubby thought it was good but messy to eat since the cake is topped with a hard pasty shell that shatters.
We also had the Napoleon which is layers of light crispy pastry with custard in between.
Sadly, the Italian Napoleon doesn't taste half as good as a Chinese Napoleon.
If you go to a good Chinese bakery in Chinatown, try their Napoleon because there are nuts in it and special sweet crispy layers that reminds you of a candy bar inside.
Hubby liked the Napoleon the best
I got my parents a slice of mixed fruit cake
and yes, they did like it.
The pastries are all very pretty here
so if you want to impress someone, buy a few pastries and get a box which is complimentary.
My four pastries came to 16 dollars but they do take credit card.
cake.author: Lorissa W.
cake.review:
I've been to Dianda's for over twenty years.

Yesterday, I bought four items (4 dollars each). 

I was most disappointed with the custard clam.  Some Yelpers call this item a custard puff but it's really more of a giant pastry clam with lots of custard in it.  Sadly, it's not as good as it used to be.  There were half as much custard and the custard itself was not creamy but more like overcooked cream (too dense and sweet).  I think they cooked the custard too long because that is how custard tastes when you cook it and condense it too long.  The shell or clam pastry didn't have that nice crispy sugar coating it used to, it was slightly soggy and doughy.  My memories of this perfect pastry has died.  I think it's because over the years, they have different bakers and this baker just isn't very good.

The original rum cake is pretty because the strawberry red color is the actual rum and it has custard in it.   Hubby thought it was good but messy to eat since the cake is topped with a hard pasty shell that shatters.  We also had the Napoleon which is layers of light crispy pastry with custard in between.  Sadly, the Italian Napoleon doesn't taste half as good as a Chinese Napoleon.  If you go to a good Chinese bakery in Chinatown, try their Napoleon because there are nuts in it and special sweet crispy layers that reminds you of a candy bar inside.  Hubby liked the Napoleon the best but that's because he hasn't tried the Chinese version yet.  

Don't let the size fool you, these pastries are huge but they are super light and not very sweet so you can inhale them.  Unfortunately,  I found all of the pastries sitting out on the counter a little too long, it didn't taste fresh enough.

I got my parents a slice of mixed fruit cake and yes, they did like it.  The pastries are all very pretty here so if you want to impress someone, buy a few pastries and get a box which is complimentary.  My four pastries came to 16 dollars but they do take credit card.

excerpts: We ordered a 5 tier cake of chocolate rum I believe and it was delicious !
My only down fall was that at the time of cutting it, it would not cut so easy but besides that the cake was beautiful and tasted great !
cake.author: Patricia A.
cake.review: Dianda's bakery  was referred to us on behalf of our venue as a package deal . However, we didn't go through the package and decided to look around first but nothing compared to the taste and quality of diandas cakes. The cakes are a bit pricey but very well worth it ! We ordered a 5 tier cake of chocolate rum I believe and it was delicious ! My only down fall was that at the time of cutting it, it would not cut so easy but besides that the cake was beautiful and tasted great !

excerpts: This is not like a true ITALIAN bakery, we went all the way over there based on reviews to pick up a N.Y. cheesecake and a rum cake, needless to say once we got to Dianda's we passed on the cheesecake and the run cake we ordered  6 single items for $ 46.00 and only liked 2 of the items.
I don't get the claim of Italian bakery or the prices.
If your looking for Italian then go to North beach.
cake.author: Tammi G.
cake.review: This is not like a true ITALIAN bakery, we went all the way over there based on reviews to pick up a N.Y. cheesecake and a rum cake, needless to say once we got to Dianda's we passed on the cheesecake and the run cake we ordered  6 single items for $ 46.00 and only liked 2 of the items. I don't get the claim of Italian bakery or the prices. If your looking for Italian then go to North beach.

excerpts: The peach cake is my favorite
cake.author: Linda J.
cake.review: Best in town. Love the flavor not too sweet just perfect! Must order in advance always! The peach cake is my favorite

excerpts: Also, 20 were supposed to be white cake with whipped cream on top..but instead all 40 of them had the gross chocolate frosting.
Lame.
cake.author: Jana G.
cake.review:
I am extremely disappointed with this place.  I spent 130 bucks for 40 cupcakes for my son's birthday.  I wanted these cupcakes to be as good as the rest of the food I had lined up.  What a MAJOR disappointment!!  When my husband brought them home they were cold...as if frozen. 

Then I heard from another that they no longer go here because they now freeze items prior to purchase.  These cupcakes were dry and tasteless....the chocolate a little less so.  The frosting was VERY unsatisfying...as if made with Crisco instead of butter.  Hell, even the kids didn't eat them. I wish I would have thought to photograph the voluminous amount of non-eaten cupcakes on abandoned plates and in the garbage.  

Also, 20 were supposed to be white cake with whipped cream on top..but instead all 40 of them had the gross chocolate frosting.   Lame. I did have guests that DIDN'T WANT chocolate!

I am sorry but when you place an order with a bakery YOU EXPECT THEM TO BAKE IT FRESH!!!!!!! And get the order right. I will never go here again.  Used to be great...now tastes like cheap, fake ingredients.  I knew I should have baked them myself.  130 bucks for 40 disgusting cupcakes!!!!!! Really????????
Would gave been happy to pay if they were good...at least we had delicious Mitchell's ice cream on the side...

excerpts: This old SF bakery (32 years) http://s3-media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/C_J0sFjtQfUfrhOEJk5OgA/l.jpg is famous for rum cakes and the St. Honore Cake, a local favorite.

About the St. Honore Cake: in my opinion Victoria Pastry Co. makes a more "elegant" (clean defined layers and less whipped cream) version which some older customers prefer, while Dianda's version looks more traditional.
Schubert's version is a decent runner up.
Stella Pastry's version has more cake, compared to the others.

: I love the Fedoretti ($2.75), http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5aIN1SRRYQ7K9vaAv4-X5w/l.jpg rum flavored chocolate mousse over amaretto cookie (similar to baked marzipan) and covered in dark chocolate; http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fWvL7-kjFk3E3tjpk-LgtQ/l.jpg and the beautiful fruit tarts ($3.75, all pastries).
cake.author: Luis C.
cake.review:
This old SF bakery (32 years) http://s3-media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/C_J0sFjtQfUfrhOEJk5OgA/l.jpg is famous for rum cakes and the St. Honore Cake, a local favorite. But sometimes the attitude of the service can be a turn off for me.

About the St. Honore Cake: in my opinion Victoria Pastry Co. makes a more "elegant" (clean defined layers and less whipped cream) version which some older customers prefer, while Dianda's version looks more traditional. Schubert's version is a decent runner up. Stella Pastry's version has more cake, compared to the others. And the "nazi" pastry chef at Patisserie Delanghe had the best cream puffs, but he retired and closed his shop last year.

There's a nice assortment of cookies, but a bit pricey at $15/lb. http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/JECyfYBuYdx8g1GWNCJs8g/l.jpg Also on display are custom cakes waiting to be picked up. http://s3-media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/NujufFeRYCk-CAuWqacM3Q/l.jpg For last minute party purchases, consider buying an almond torte or a panetone. http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/h9Y0rA1KHbrgixgav3UueQ/l.jpg

And yes, the pastries are made fresh daily, but the cannoli are pre-filled. That's not proper for cannoli.

Other popular items: I love the Fedoretti ($2.75), http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5aIN1SRRYQ7K9vaAv4-X5w/l.jpg rum flavored chocolate mousse over amaretto cookie (similar to baked marzipan) and covered in dark chocolate; http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fWvL7-kjFk3E3tjpk-LgtQ/l.jpg and the beautiful fruit tarts ($3.75, all pastries). 5 stars for most food items, deducted stars for the -tude service.

Hours: Mon-Sat 6am-6pm, Sun 6am-4:30pm

excerpts: I got a couple slices of cake and those were also pretty good.
I don't think I'll stop by again in the future though, is just rather go somewhere where the service is nicer.
cake.author: caroline y.
cake.review: While waiting for my burrito at neighboring La Taqueria, I popped into this Italian bakery to check it out and pick up a few items. They have cases full of cakes and cookies, but I spotted my favorite almond pignioli cookies and had to get those. They actually turned out to be pretty good - not as great as my favorite ones in Boston, but still solid. The girl who was helping me was just not super nice - I think she hated her job. I ordered some cookies and when I got home a realized that she given me the wrong ones! Ah well. I got a couple slices of cake and those were also pretty good. I don't think I'll stop by again in the future though, is just rather go somewhere where the service is nicer.

excerpts: The St, Honore cake is absolutely decadent and to die for!
cake.author: Mike M.
cake.review: Simply the best. The St, Honore cake is absolutely decadent and to die for!

excerpts: To Dianda's cake writers: You had one job, one job.
Wrote "grandpa" instead of "grandma" on her 80th birthday cake...it took a little bit of creative hiding to rectify the situation, but all was not lost.
Also helps that she can't read English, but that's besides the point, haha.
That said, the strawberry cake really was quite good.
The cake was moist and not too sweet.
Large, halved strawberries adorned the cake and it was beautifully presented (minus the typo).
Would I order it again?
Most definitely.
cake.author: Elaine Y.
cake.review: To Dianda's cake writers: You had one job, one job. Wrote "grandpa" instead of "grandma" on her 80th birthday cake...it took a little bit of creative hiding to rectify the situation, but all was not lost. Also helps that she can't read English, but that's besides the point, haha. That said, the strawberry cake really was quite good. The cake was moist and not too sweet. Large, halved strawberries adorned the cake and it was beautifully presented (minus the typo). Would I order it again? Most definitely.

excerpts: I haven't been there to often in the last year or so, but this weekend my loving Husband stopped in and bought one of those almond cakes and my favorite, a Chocolate Cherry cake.
But that Chocolate Cherry cake?
That was just beyond bad.
But that Chocolate Cherry cake?
That was just beyond bad.
The cherries, which were previously tart sweet and tasted of cherry, have been replaced with an artificial tasting cherry filling.
The thick whipped cream based filling and frosting is now a gross greasy frosting/buttercream with a shortening base.
Yuck.
cake.author: Sara D.
cake.review:
Talk about Hero to Zero...

I first remember entering Dianda's in the 70's. The signature Almond Torte was so good. Over the years I have had pretty much everything they make. Once upon a time I was there often enough to be a regular, even rated a smile from the counter ladies. I stayed a customer when the original owners sold to the current owners and while there were a few rough patches to get through they managed.

I haven't been there to often in the last year or so, but this weekend my loving Husband stopped in and bought one of those almond cakes and my favorite, a Chocolate Cherry cake.

WHAT a disappointment.

The Almond Torte wasn't bad. But it was a bit dry, and seemed to have less almond paste than previously.

But that Chocolate Cherry cake? That was just beyond bad. The cherries, which were previously tart sweet and tasted of cherry, have been replaced with an artificial tasting cherry filling. The thick whipped cream based filling and frosting is now a gross greasy frosting/buttercream with a shortening base. Yuck. The chocolate ganache has been replaced with an overly sweet chocolate coloured icing.

The quality of ingredients has taken a HUGE hit recently. And the taste has too.

Just bad news all around. Man am I sad : -(

excerpts: I got a slice of black forest cake, and it was pretty good!
A little sweet for my taste but no complaints!
cake.author: Carmen C.
cake.review: I love their great selection of desserts. Theres so many cakes as well as cookies to choose from. It's hard deciding on what to get! I got a slice of black forest cake, and it was pretty good!  A little sweet for my taste but no complaints!

excerpts: I ordered a mango tres leche cake on Sunday.
It looked amazing but sadly it was not moist.
It was flavorful but lacked that authentic tres leche moistness and flavor.
cake.author: Robert O.
cake.review: I've been here many times for their cookies, pastry and cakes. I ordered a mango tres leche cake on Sunday. It looked amazing but sadly it was not moist. It was flavorful but lacked that authentic tres leche moistness and flavor.

and I to celebrate out

The cake was light and flavorful.
I would come back again to try another slice of cake that they have or other pastries.
cake.author: Marck N.
cake.review:
The chocolate cake slice that I bought for my honey and I to celebrate out 10 year anniversary month was very tasty.  The creme was filled with a slight tasty of rum.   The cake was light and flavorful. It was a perfect cap to the evening on the Sunday with leftover to eat in the morning.

My partner thought the buttercream frosting was too heavy, but I thought it was good. I would come back again to try another slice of cake that they have or other pastries.

excerpts:
I know nothing about this Saint except the following:

"St. Honoré Cake is named for the French patron saint of bakers and pastry chefs, Saint Honoré or Honoratus

If you cut into a slice of their St. Honoré Cake, you'll bite into a strong rum flavored cream in the center, pastry with crunchy bits of caramelized sugar on the bottom, a creme puff border on the outside, and whipped cream on top of it all.
If you aren't a fan of cream puffs, Dianda's has loads of other treats to keep your sweet tooth satisfied.
Also, copious sugar filled blessings on Daniel L. who preaches the gospel of Dianda's luscious St. Honoré Cake.
cake.author: Amy C.
cake.review:
God bless St. Honoré.

I know nothing about this Saint except the following:

"St. Honoré Cake is named for the French patron saint of bakers and pastry chefs, Saint Honoré or Honoratus (d. 600 AD), bishop of Amiens.  This classic french dessert is a circle of puff pastry at its base with a ring of pâte à choux piped on the outer edge. After the base is baked small cream puffs are dipped in caramelized sugar and attached side by side on top of the circle of the pâte à choux. This base is traditionally filled with crème chiboust and finished with whipped cream using a special St. Honore piping tip."

(I loves me some Wikipedia.)

Where can you get this classic French dessert?  Why at an Italian bakery in the Mission of course!  If you cut into a slice of their St. Honoré Cake, you'll bite into a strong rum flavored cream in the center, pastry with crunchy bits of caramelized sugar on the bottom, a creme puff border on the outside, and whipped cream on top of it all.  If you aren't a fan of cream puffs, Dianda's has loads of other treats to keep your sweet tooth satisfied.  I am partial to their Italian cookies, especially the addictive almond flavored amaretti.

Also, copious sugar filled blessings on Daniel L. who preaches the gospel of Dianda's luscious St. Honoré Cake.

(Talk about a saint!)

excerpts: I had to get a connoli, rum cake, napolen cake, amaretti cookies, and a couple other cakes that I don't remember the name of but were amazing nonetheless.
So if I'm Clemenza, I would have said "Leave the gun, take the connolis, rum cake, amaretti cookies, and all the cakes filled with flaky, custardy, sweet goodness.
So if I'm Clemenza, I would have said "Leave the gun, take the connolis, rum cake, amaretti cookies, and all the cakes filled with flaky, custardy, sweet goodness.
cake.author: Michael L.
cake.review:
"Leave the gun.  Take the Connolis."  is the famous line that Peter Clemenza said in the movie ' The Godfather '.  

With my fascination with mafia movies, along with my eyes fixated on the counter that is filled with Italian Pastries, those words came to mind.  Looking at all the pastries was to me, like looking at a bouquet of flowers.  Absolutely beautiful in appearance.  The sweet smell of fresh baked pastries.  I didn't know where to start, I wanted it all.  Like a kid in a candy store.  Or should I say a fat kid in a bakery.

I had to get a connoli, rum cake, napolen cake, amaretti cookies, and a couple other cakes that I don't remember the name of but were amazing nonetheless.  

So if I'm Clemenza, I would have said "Leave the gun, take the connolis, rum cake, amaretti cookies, and all the cakes filled with flaky, custardy, sweet goodness."

excerpts: I've had & ordered their St. Honore Cake for special occasion, truly AMAZING!!!!!
cake.author: Janet T.
cake.review:
Old School Italian Bakery....the BEST!!!!!!   Don't go to North Beach, just head to the Mission.

To Die For ....Authentic cannolis & Napoleons! They have cookies (sold by the pound) that are so delish!!!!  I've had & ordered their St. Honore Cake for special occasion, truly AMAZING!!!!!

Some people say its a little pricey here. I say ITS DEFINITELY WORTH IT.

Parking can be challenging.  As I said, sooooo worth it!

excerpts: I got a slice of  napolean, tiramisu, rum cake, and their popular canoli.
the lady helping me was very nice and patient providing some advice as well.
I didn't try all the dessert
but I did have a sliver of the tiramisu
and it was really good.
the cake wasn't super soggy and nice balance of coffee.
the rest of the desserts lasted until dinner as well and everyone said thye were really good.
the pastry was flaky and very flavorful.
the rum cake was rather strong too.
the rum cake was rather strong too.
cake.author: Tao Tao W.
cake.review:
$4 for all pastries - better than north beach. went here this past friday to grab some pastries for my fiance's birthday. I wasn't expecting to find an italian bakery in the middle of mission but its convienently located right off the 24th st bart so its easy to get to. 

its a pretty nice sized store with a variety of different cookies, pastries, and also pies. I got a slice of  napolean, tiramisu, rum cake, and their popular canoli. the lady helping me was very nice and patient providing some advice as well. I didn't try all the dessert but I did have a sliver of the tiramisu and it was really good. the cake wasn't super soggy and nice balance of coffee. the rest of the desserts lasted until dinner as well and everyone said thye were really good. the pastry was flaky and very flavorful. the rum cake was rather strong too.

Also they take CC and if you call, they will put aside pieces for you! oh and for your price you pay, you get a nice big slice or portion.

excerpts:
You can have your cake and eat it, too!

For better or worse, you can buy by the slice which means you don't need 'special' occasions to nom some fruit and whipped cream between fluffy layers of cake.
cake.author: Alissa A.
cake.review:
You can have your cake and eat it, too!

For better or worse, you can buy by the slice which means you don't need 'special' occasions to nom some fruit and whipped cream between fluffy layers of cake.

On days you're feeling less indulgent, opt for cookies (sold by the pound) all labeled with any dietary need you have - dairy free, nut free, gluten free etc.

Open early (6:00 during the week), I used to pop in for a morning coffee.

Now, it's on the way home that I'm tempted. The biscotti are just too good, if there ever were such a thing.

excerpts: I can't get enough of the Tres Leches cake with strawberries.
And I'm not a big strawberry person.
But the fruit is a sideline player in this rich, dense, incredibly moist delicacy.
I ordered a cake for 35 - 50 people and couldn't carry it out, it was so heavy.
But a robust, behemoth of a helpful woman lifted it like it was a kleenex and whisked it out to my car.
For my 50th birthday cake, I couldn't have done any better.
A line out the door tells the story right away!
You know when you see a line out the door of any store or restaurant in San Francisco, the place has got it going on, because San Franciscans know what's good.
It was $144.50, by the way, so not a Safeway cake.
But you get what you pay for - and SO much more.
You want a cake people talk about, this is the one.
There is no room in the world for cheap and stupid cakes, so go to Dianda's.
cake.author: Erin-Kate W.
cake.review: I can't get enough of the Tres Leches cake with strawberries.  And I'm not a big strawberry person.  But the fruit is a sideline player in this rich, dense, incredibly moist delicacy.  I ordered a cake for 35 - 50 people and couldn't carry it out, it was so heavy.  But a robust, behemoth of a helpful woman lifted it like it was a kleenex and whisked it out to my car.  For my 50th birthday cake, I couldn't have done any better.  A line out the door tells the story right away!  You know when you see a line out the door of any store or restaurant in San Francisco, the place has got it going on, because San Franciscans know what's good.  It was $144.50, by the way, so not a Safeway cake.  But you get what you pay for - and SO much more.  You want a cake people talk about, this is the one.  There is no room in the world for cheap and stupid cakes, so go to Dianda's.

excerpts: Their Rum Cake, Tres Leches, and Chocolate Cake with strawberries inside are my favorites!
cake.author: Sarina A.
cake.review: Many people rave about Mazzettis as being the best bakery, but that just means youve never been to DIANDA! Dianda is a staple in the Bay Area with a location in SF and one in the Peninsula (San Mateo). Their Rum Cake, Tres Leches, and Chocolate Cake with strawberries inside are my favorites!

excerpts: I needed a cake decorated with an American flag design.
I tried to order it in advance but the very helpful gal at the front said it would be better to come the morning I needed it.. it would be slow and I could ask and the guys in the back
He said he would decorate a strawberry cake with fruit n cream.
Then he said it would be $45 because they had to charge for the decorating and the cake.
I guess I should have asked first because I really think that's excessive for an 8 inch cake with a flag design of one row raspberries and the next a line of whipped cream?
Anyway, I figured it's what I wanted
Turns out a "strawberry cake" is just yellow cake with a layer of strawberry in between???
What?
and the cake wasn't moist.
It was dried out even though supposedly made that day?
I will make my own cake next time.
cake.author: A P.
cake.review:
2.5 & a long rant.

I needed a cake decorated with an American flag design. I tried to order it in advance but the very helpful gal at the front said it would be better to come the morning I needed it.. it would be slow and I could ask and the guys in the back & they would make my request right away. 

I showed up that day. They were confused. Not sure how to make it work. Unsure. Said they had no blue berries, just used the last of their bananas, didn't know if it could be done. I am feeling frustrated now. 

Eventually a very friendly staff member told me he could take care of me. Only reason for the 3 stars is because the staff was so friendly. He said he would decorate a strawberry cake with fruit n cream. He did it and it came out cute!!

Then he said it would be $45 because they had to charge for the decorating and the cake. I guess I should have asked first because I really think that's excessive for an 8 inch cake with a flag design of one row raspberries and the next a line of whipped cream? Anyway, I figured it's what I wanted so whatever....  

Turns out a "strawberry cake" is just yellow cake with a layer of strawberry in between??? What? :( and the cake wasn't moist. It was dried out even though supposedly made that day? All in all, I felt disappointed and ripped off. 

I will make my own cake next time.

excerpts:
Took the bf here after a hearty breakfast, and it probably took us 15 minutes to find what we really wanted, but we decided to play it safe and got a slice of the classic cake with strawberries on top for $3.75.

The cake is very moist and not dry whatsoever. 
The icing and the strawberries combined with the cake itself is a formidable duo that'll leave your mouth wanting more.
cake.author: Jerianne G.
cake.review:
Someone pinch me, i am in love !

There's always lots of hidden gems in the mission district of San Francisco, and this place is definitely one of them!

A crazy selection of baked goods, cakes, and pastries that'll keep you coming back because you'll suddenly feel the need to try everything out.

Took the bf here after a hearty breakfast, and it probably took us 15 minutes to find what we really wanted, but we decided to play it safe and got a slice of the classic cake with strawberries on top for $3.75.

Yummmmmmm~ The cake is very moist and not dry whatsoever. The icing and the strawberries combined with the cake itself is a formidable duo that'll leave your mouth wanting more.

Definitely will be coming back to try way more stuff :)!

excerpts: Makes me not even want to step foot into their bakery... asked about ordering a cake, and ended up having an irritated woman basically telling me off about how I should've called earlier if I wanted a cake...
but that's why I freakin called!
How else would I understand the protocols and the ways of this bakery!

cake.review: Terribly rude on the phone. Makes me not even want to step foot into their bakery... asked about ordering a cake, and ended up having an irritated woman basically telling me off about how I should've called earlier if I wanted a cake... but that's why I freakin called! How else would I understand the protocols and the ways of this bakery!

excerpts: Either way, it seems like cake is the way to go here.
cake.author: Jennifer W.
cake.review:
One of my weekend rituals is to stock up on pastries as breakfast for the following week. It's the perfect excuse to take home a bunch of sweet goods without feeling too guilty. Not only does it go through the test of time, but my resistance of eating them all up before the week even ends. I think they're pretty good measurements of how much I like them.

Anyway, I came here yesterday to stock up for the week and I'm sad to say my pastries took a beating before they even got home. The mushroom pastry was my favorite. It was drizzled in honey that hardened over, which gave it a nice crunch at times. The apple pastry was alright. The pastry part was nice and flaky, but the apple was a bit underbaked and perhaps an extra bit of cinnamon would've been nice too. The apricot tart was good. It was sweet and apricoty, but the glaze was too thick for me. I felt like half the topping was the glaze and not the fruit. Either way, it seems like cake is the way to go here.

Yum!!! 

We made a special trip out to the mission just to try out dianda's bakery...so, so good!

excerpts: I highly recommend their chocolate cake with cappuccino filling.

Their cannoli?

They sell a number of cakes by the slice.  The staff helps you choose the right treat based on your tastes.  Their cannoli?  To die for!

excerpts: I just had the smallest sliver of Dianda's Chocolate Rum Cake today at work (I truly am a slave to sugar).
The cake was layered and huge.
The chocolate frosting was light, decadent, and full of rich rum.
The cake portion was spongey, soft, and tasted just made.

Their Almond Torte, St Honore Cake, and Tres Leche Cake are famous and could bring any sugar fiend out of hiding

Trust.
cake.author: Jessica T.
cake.review:
I just had the smallest sliver of Dianda's Chocolate Rum Cake today at work (I truly am a slave to sugar). The cake was layered and huge. The chocolate frosting was light, decadent, and full of rich rum. The cake portion was spongey, soft, and tasted just made.

It was truly dangerous stuff and I now get it.

I now get why this local establishment is so beloved in San Francisco. All of their products are baked fresh daily on their premises, using the finest ingredients. Their Almond Torte, St Honore Cake, and Tres Leche Cake are famous and could bring any sugar fiend out of hiding

Trust.

excerpts: They have the most wonderful rum cake.
I got the chocolate mousse tart, the last one!
Am I lucky or what?
Just go in and smell, that's how a bakery should smell like.
The cookies are awesome!
This Italian bakery is as authentic as you can get for a non-Italian.
I'm gushing over your cakes.
cake.author: Helen L.
cake.review: I'm amazed I never wrote a review!  What happened?  They have the most wonderful rum cake.  I got the chocolate mousse tart, the last one!  Am I lucky or what?  Just go in and smell, that's how a bakery should smell like.  The cookies are awesome!  This Italian bakery is as authentic as you can get for a non-Italian.  I'm gushing over your cakes.

excerpts: I have been buying a st honored cake for my husband's birthday for 22 years as well as other occasions.
I was very disappointed with the cake I bought on friday.
It tasted nothing like any previous cake.
The cake was dry & the custard was thin.
Hardly any sugar glaze & the custard filled balls tasted stale.
I did buy a few other pastries and they were good.
Will continue buy other pastries but no more St Honores cakes!
cake.author: Bonnie E.
cake.review: I have been buying a st honored cake for my husband's birthday for 22 years as well as other occasions.  I was very disappointed with the cake I bought on friday.  It tasted nothing like any previous cake. The cake was dry & the custard was thin. Hardly any sugar glaze & the custard filled balls tasted stale. I did buy a few other pastries and they were good. Will continue buy other pastries but no more St Honores cakes!

excerpts: Their Rum cake and Tres Leches is like no other.
I've never had such a juicy cake in my life!
Their Napolean pastry... incredable.
But their creme dela creme  has got to be their St. Honore especially with the chocolate rum filling and caramel crunch on top and bottom!
cake.author: Susie Z.
cake.review:
I'm in my 50s and ever since I've been alive this has been the place our family goes to for cakes regardless of celebration.  It's tradition!

Their Rum cake and Tres Leches is like no other. I've never had such a juicy cake in my life!  Their Napolean pastry... incredable.  But their creme dela creme  has got to be their St. Honore especially with the chocolate rum filling and caramel crunch on top and bottom!  AMAZING!

There are two locations.  San Francisco and San Mateo.  I've only been to the one on Mission and 25th St.  Staff is all family there and very curteous. Definately a must if you haven't already been!!!

excerpts: Cannoli, Napoleons, St. Honores Cake, Eclairs, Cream Puffs, Princess Cake, etc.
cake.author: Alice L.
cake.review:
Most pastry items are $3.75. Lots of variations of the same thing: flaky pastry crust paired with custard or whipped cream. Cannoli, Napoleons, St. Honores Cake, Eclairs, Cream Puffs, Princess Cake, etc. This place has all your Italian, artery-clogging fixings. 

They have a good selection of cookies, which are just as butter-heavy. I would recommend the anise biscotti and the Fedoretti, which is chocolate covered mousse over a amaretti cookie, perfectly chewy. I once got a box of cookies for my coworkers and they came in a Dianda's stickered box tied with string. 

Of the items I had, I found most to be lacking a little finesse, but serve well as your standard homemade comfort desserts. The custard filling is a little too gooey and sweet for my liking though, while the cream filling is too dense/solid. The famous mushroom pastry covered in hardened honey and filled with chocolate rum cream had turned quite soggy by the time I had it but otherwise it was quite good. 

They sell petit fours for $2.50, almost all marzipan and not bad if not for the steep price. They also sell these at the nearby Lovejoy's Tearoom.

excerpts: Don't attempt to just stroll in to pick up a cake on holidays without pre ordering!
The cakes are as tasty as they are beautiful & the cookies are a well kept secret!
The amaretto & the amaretti are favorites!

They also sell individual sized slices of cake & chocolate rum mousse filled cream puffs!
Enjoy!
cake.author: M F.
cake.review:
Dianda's is a diet buster! This is Italian pastries at its best. This bakery has been here at least 30 years and has a loyal following. Don't attempt to just stroll in to pick up a cake on holidays without pre ordering!  The cakes are as tasty as they are beautiful & the cookies are a well kept secret! The amaretto & the amaretti are favorites! They also sell individual sized slices of cake & chocolate rum mousse filled cream puffs!
Enjoy!

excerpts: Rum cake with custard...think of me as Homer Simpson with a donut.
Oh man...this is definitely drool worthy!
Soft, decadent, perfectly airy and delicious.
I need to try all their cakes.
cake.author: Jay H.
cake.review:
Rum cake with custard...think of me as Homer Simpson with a donut. Oh man...this is definitely drool worthy! Soft, decadent, perfectly airy and delicious. I need to try all their cakes. It was sweet without being overwhelming. 

They sell single servings and good luck to you in choosing your sugar fix! There are endless options at Dianda's.

excerpts: I believe it was their St. Honore Cake.
Absolutely amazing.
I would definitely order a cake from here!
cake.author: Natalie M.
cake.review: Tried one of their cakes!  I believe it was their St. Honore Cake. Absolutely amazing. It had all these rum-flavored cream-puffs and they were delicious. Perfectly sweet, and great texture. I would definitely order a cake from here!

excerpts: Definitely going back for other sweets, maybe even a cake or 2!
cake.author: Marissa H.
cake.review:
I now understand the cult following...and I'm now 1 of the followers! 

Stopped in after SF Street Food Festival to pick up goodies to-go. 

The Florentine is a chocolatey-crispy cookie that is wafer-ish. It's not a true Florentine as those are made with cherries & this was definitely missing cherries. But it was good. 

Anise biscotti - amazing. True anise flavor with seeds sprinkled in the biscotti. Perfect small dipping size. 

Chocolate tonboni (think I misspelled that). It's a sugar cookie w/ a chocolate ball on top. Good, chocolate flavor with a soft cookie underneath. Small, easily eaten in 2 bites.

($1.85 for all 3 cookies)

slice of Tiramisu - easily the highlight of the tasting. And I don't even like Tiramisu! I bought it on the advice of the woman helping me, & she's spot on! The Savoardi (biscuit that's soaked in coffee; usually Ladyfingers in the US b/c Sav is hard to find) was perfectly soaked in coffee. The layers of cream with chocolate & espresso powder, the biscuit that wasn't soggy, the blend of coffee and sweet cream...it all produced a wonderful flavor that I wish all places serving Tiramisu would emulate (or, just order from Dianda's!). ($3.75 per slice)

Customer service is excellent. The woman never rushed me even though I had many questions and took some time to make up my mind. There are so many offerings, it's hard to decide! Definitely going back for other sweets, maybe even a cake or 2!
